loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ghana's Ernestina specializes in handcrafted African drums and wood carvings. She would like to invest in the purchase of wood and paints, as well as leather for the drums.

Ernestina has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I was born in the eastern region of Ghana and trained in dressmaking, but realized that the trade would not do well in my town. I therefore trained for three years as a wood carver, and began developing woodcarvings on my own. Though carving has long been regarded as the preserve of men, I am glad that I have been able not only to infiltrate but also to make an impact on the trade."

"I will always will be grateful to the good people who are helping to fund this microcredit for me, so that I may grow my business."

Use the link below to view Ernestina's African drums and wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1447

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood and paints, as well as leather for the drums

loans.name: Fabian Mesias

texts.es:
FABIAN TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO NO TIENE HIJOS, VIVE CON LOS PADRES EN EL CANTÓN CHILLANES PROVICNIA DE BOLÍVRA.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

FABIAN SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE FRÉJOL, MAÍZ, ADEMÁS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE CERDOS Y GANADO.

SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR SEMILLAS, UREA, FERTILIZANTES, HERBICIDAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO NECESARIO PARA LAS SIEMBRAS. LAS COMPRAS LAS REALIZARÁ EN CHILLANES.

EL SUEÑO ES INDEPENDISARCE Y TENER TERRENOS PROPIOS.
EN EL TIMEPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PRACTICAR EL DEPORTE Y DISFRUTAR DE LAS FIESTAS DE LA COMUNIDAD.
texts.en:
24-year-old Fabian is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The Virgen de Baños community bank was formed in Mama Sara de Cerritos community, some 30 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.

Fabian's business is growing beans and corn.  He also raises pigs and cattle.

Fabian is requesting this loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and herbicides.  This loan will help him buy what he needs for his crops.  He will make his purchases in Chillanes.

Fabian's dream is to become independent and own his own land.  In his free time, he enjoys taking part in sports and participating in local festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling of tubers, particularly yams, in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Esi is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of tubers. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell a greater quantity of tubers.

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Maregane est trésorière  du  groupement d’affaire Salama, jeune entrepreneur,  âgée de 27  ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Son conjoint est un petit commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse de Boissons sucrées.  Elle commença cette affaire avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia des fonds additionnels de crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il ya environs 10 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  10 casiers de Fanta, Coca colla, vital ‘ô, etc.  à marchander.  Les casses de bouteilles, carences de marchandises, sont de défis majeurs pour son activité. Lors de carence de produits, elles sont parfois obligées d’aller s’approvisionner au Rwanda, dans le pays voisin.  Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
This client, Maregane, is the treasurer of the business group Salama. A young entrepreneur, she is 27 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her husband is a small-scale merchant of various goods. This client sells sweetened beverages. She started this business with her own funds gotten from her husband. Later on, she benefited from additional loan funds from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for about ten years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 10 cases of Fanta, Coca colla, vital, etc. to sell. Breakage and merchandise shortages are the main challenges for her business. When merchandise is short, she is sometimes compelled to go get supplies in Rwanda, a neighboring country. 

She would like to grow her capital and educate her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-loan support.

loans.use: to purchase Fanta, Coca colla, vital, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyirakanyana est secrétaire du groupe d’affaire Maombi, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 39 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de braises au marché Majengo. Son conjoint est un gardien auprès d’une organisation privée. Elle commença cette affaire avec son fonds propre reçu par son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit additionnel de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 7 sacs de braises. Les tracasseries administratives, le vol constituent un défi pour son activité.  Elle souhaite augmenter son capital et scolariser ses enfants. In fine, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Nyirakanyana, the borrower, is the secretary of the Maombi business group.  She is an experienced entrepreneur and the 39-year-old mother of seven children who all go to school.  She sells charcoal at the Majengo market.  Her husband works as a security guard for a private organization.

Nyirakanyana started her business using her own funds, received from her husband.  Later on, she benefited from additional credit from Hekima.  This new loan will help her to buy seven bags of charcoal.

Administrative hassle, as well as theft, are the challenges that Nyirakanyana has to deal with while conducting her business. 

Nyirakanyana wishes to increase her capital and be able to send her children to school.  In the end, she is very grateful to Hekima for supporting small entrepreneurs through microcredit.

loans.use: to buy seven bags of charcoal.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cristian Patricio

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 29 años decedad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

Cristian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de fréjol, mañiz, mora, además se ddeica a la crianza de ganado.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras lo realizará en Chillanes.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la pérdida de producción por la presencia de diferentes fenómenos naturalez.
en el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte y disfrutar de las fiestas de las comunidades y el carnaval.
texts.en:
Cristian is 29 years old and married with two children.  He lives with his spouse and their children in Chillanes, in the Bolivar Province.  The "Virgen de Baños" communal bank is composed of the Cerritos Mama Sara community, which is 30 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office.  

Cristian makes his living in agriculture and grows beans, corn and blackberries, in addition to raising livestock.  He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, manure, herbicides and fertilizers.  With the help of this credit, he'll be able to buy what is necessary for his crops.  He will make these purchases in Chillanes.  The challenges Cristian faces include production losses due to the presence of natural phenomenons.  In his free time, he likes to play sports and enjoys community festivals and Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chimpayi est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Zawadi, jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 29 ans, divorcée et mère d’un enfant. La cliente est vendeuse des friperies.  Elle commença cette affaire avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 1 ballon de sous vêtements, de singlets et de chaussettes. Les tracasseries administratives constituent un défi pour son activité.  Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et scolariser son enfant. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Chimpayi is advisor of the Zawadi Group. She is a young 29-year-old entrepreneur, and a divorced mother of one child. 

She sells second-hand clothing and started her business with a credit loan from Hekima.

This new loan will be used to buy one bale of undergarments, sleeveless shirts and socks. Administrative red tape is a challenge for her business.

She wants to buy a plot of land and provide schooling for her child. She is very thankful to Hekima for its support through micro-financing. It is worth mentioning that one of the group members is carrying her child.

loans.use: buy a bale of clothes (undergarments, sleeveless shirts and socks)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabuo est secrétaire  du  groupement d’affaire Neema, jeune entrepreneur,  âgée de 33  ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Son conjoint est un militaire dans les forces armées loyalistes. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons.  Elle commença cette affaire avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia des fonds additionnels de crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il ya 13 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  5 paniers de poissons à marchander.  Les détériorations,   et pourritures  sont de défis majeurs pour son activité.  Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire pour sa famille. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.Il sied de signaler que  sur la photo, il ya plus de clients, qui ont voulu participé à la photo de souvenir.
texts.en:
Kabuo is Secretary of the Neema Group. A young 33-year-old entrepreneur, she is married with two children. Her husband is a soldier in the loyalist armed forces.

She is a fish merchant. She started this business activity using funds received from her husband. Later on she was granted additional funding through the Hekima MFI. She has been running her business for the past 13 years.

This new loan will be used to buy five baskets of fish for resale. Damage and rot are major challenges in this type of activity.

She wants to increase her capital worth, and build a home for her family. She is very thankful to Hekima for its support through micro-financing.
It should be noted that in the photo, there are additional members, who wanted to join the souvenir photo.

loans.use: buy five baskets of fish

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahindo est trésorière et doyenne du groupe d’affaire Tosheka, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 60 ans, veuve et mère de 9 enfants, dont 3 étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propre foyers. La cliente est vendeuse de braises au marché Katindo. Elle commença cette affaire avec son fonds propre reçu par un membre de sa famille. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit additionnel de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 sacs de braises. Les tracasseries administratives constituent un défi pour son activité.  Elle souhaite augmenter son capital et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Kahindo, is the treasurer and most senior member of the business group Tosheka. She is an experienced entrepreneur, 60 years old, a widow, and the mother of nine children, of whom three are students, and the others have their own households. This client sells charcoal at the Katindo market. She started this business using her own funds gotten from a family member. Later on, she benefited from an additional Hekima loan. 

This new loan will serve to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for her. Red tape annoyingly amounts to a challenge for her business. She would like to increase her capital and educate her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting small-scale entrepreneurs with micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mwito Group

texts.fr: La cliente Munyerenkana est vice présidente  du  groupement d’affaire Mwito, entrepreneur,  âgée de 37  ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Son conjoint est un petit commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse de friperie.  Elle commença cette affaire avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia des fonds additionnels de crédit de l’IMF Hekima.  Il ya environs 6 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  un demi-ballon de friperie à marchander. L’insécurité, la crise financière  sont de défis majeurs pour son activité. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. In fine, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
Munyerenkana, an entrepreneur, is vice-president of the Mwito business group. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of nine children. 

Munyerenkana's husband is a small-scale general trader and Munyerenkana sells second-hand clothes. She began this business with her own money that she received from her husband. Later, she accessed additional funds in the form of loans from IMF Hekima. 

Munyerenkana has been running this business for around six years now. She will use this new loan to buy half a bale of second-hand clothes to sell. Insecurity and the financial crisis are the major challenges facing her business. She wishes to increase her capital and send her children to school. 

She would like to thank Hekima for its support through microcredit.

loans.use: to buy half a bale of second-hand clothes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Kotognontala, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, commune de Guegneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de boisson, de charbons de bois et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                        
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur septième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des boisson, de charbon de bois et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne dans le rang des assises, à partir de la droite, compte acheter une vingtaine de casiers de boissons non alcoolisées (appelé dans le jargon malien la "sucrerie" autrement dit les sodas ) avec les fournisseurs de Bamako, pour ensuite revendre au marché de Fana à une clientèle diverse et variée. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de vente de boissons.
texts.en:
The group Kotognontala consists exclusively of married women who are on average 35 years old, have 4 children, and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, Banankabougou neighborhood, Guegneka commune, Dioïla prefecture, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell drinks, charcoal and a variety of shop items.

The women of the Kotognontala group are on their 7th loan in solidarity which will be used to buy drinks, charcoal and a variety of shop items.

The client Fatoumata, the first person from the right in the row of seated people, plans to buy about 20 cases of soft drinks with the suppliers in Bamako. She will then resell them at the market in Fana to a diverse and varied clientele.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used for her family's needs and partly reinvested in her business selling drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Wagninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WAGNINAN est formé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommé Djègbè Séraphine, âgé de 55 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Djègbè Séraphine, est marié à un certain Etienne. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et deux restes à leur charge. Djègbè Séraphine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Djègbè Séraphine n'a pas fréquenté. Djègbè Séraphine vend des fruits, du charbon et des chaussures depuis près de dix huit ans ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Djègbè Séraphine désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Djègbè Séraphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WAGNINAN, un dixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WAGNINAN group has two members, who are friends. The group leader, Djègbè Séraphine, is 55 years old and can be seen holding up her hand in the photo. 

Djègbè Séraphine is married to a man named Etienne. The couple have four children. Some of the children are in school, and two of them are still dependent. Djègbè Séraphine and her husband live together with their children and share the various household charges. 

Djègbè Séraphine did not go to school. She has been selling fruit, charcoal and shoes for nearly 18 years, which enables her to provide for her family without too much difficulty. 

In order to better meet her customer’s needs, Djègbè Séraphine wishes to strengthen her business. In order to do this, she has requested a tenth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the WAGNINAN group. The previous loans have all been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy fruit, charcoal and shoes.

loans.name: Las Girasoles Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, Las Girasoles Xenacoj or The Xenacoj Sunflowers, is a group of seven women. The group was established last year. This is their second loan cycle from Friendship Bridge. These ladies primarily work in the production and sale of textiles and fabrics.

Crisanta is a 55-year-old mother of four boys. She is preliterate because when she was young, her parents were unable to provide her with the opportunity to attend school. Her husband works in the masonry business. Crisanta works in fabric and textile production, which has been her business for quite some time. In addition, she purchases and sells textiles. Crisanta travels by bus to a market three hours from her home to sell not only her own products but those of her ten providers as well.

Crisanta is excited about the loan she is about to receive from Friendship Bridge. It will allow her to buy yarn and fabric to make more products. She is happy because two of her boys are enrolled in school this year, and one of them is about to start high school. Crisanta hopes to continue to support him so that he can graduate in two years.

Both Crisanta and the other ladies of the Trust Bank, Los Girasoles Xenacoj, enjoy the training that they receive during the monthly meeting with Friendship Bridge. They especially like the icebreaker, which they find is a real stress reliever. They find the educational topics beneficial as well, especially the one about children’s rights, which was the topic of last year’s November meeting. The women want to express their deep appreciation to Kiva investors. With these loans, they have a huge opportunity to realize significant changes in their lives.

loans.use: To buy yarn and fabric to make more shirts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina, from the city of Samana, is one of the members taking a Housing loan. This is her fourth loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for over six years, having started it with her own savings. Her latest loan was invested in the business, where she sells miscellaneous goods. 

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house, at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings. 

Alejandrina started building her house several years ago, when she and her husband decided to provide a safe home for their three children. She is needing to build a water tank, and she is taking this loan for that purpose. So now she is requesting this loan to buy cement and other construction materials to construct this water tank for her house. In her community, water is not a service they receive every day, a reason why they need to save water in a tank. She thanks God, Esperanza Internacional, and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cement and other construction materials, to make a water tank for her home

loans.name: Lindys

texts.es: Lindys, de 29 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2  hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres .La actividad que realiza Lindys es la venta de bebidas gasificadas, hielo y chupetes preparados con frutas de la selva de deliciosos sabores. Cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda y congela sus productos a la temperatura que es del agrado de sus clientes a quienes atiende desde su casa de manera amable y cordial ganándose su preferencia. Tiene más de 2 años dedicándose a este oficio y hasta el momento trabaja sola.Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos que le genera, además de poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y atener a sus hijos. Por eso, tiene planes de continuar, y además incursionar en otro negocio que sería la venta de comidas rápidas con la ayuda de su hermana.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1500 soles, agradece a todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará bebidas gasificadas de diversos sabores y marcas, así como frutas, bolsas de plástico y azúcar para la preparación de sus chupetes.
texts.en:
Lindys, 29 years old, is married and had 2 children who she lives with in her parents' house. 

Lindys' business is selling fizzy drinks, ice, and ice lollies made with fruits from the jungle in delicious flavours. She relies on a refrigerator where she keeps and freezes her products to the preferred temperature of her customers, whom she attends to from her home in a kind and friendly way, winning their favour. 

She has been working at this business for more than 2 years and up to now she works alone. She likes her business because of the financial income it generates, and also because she is able to be in the comfort of her home and look after her children. For this reason, she plans to continue, and also get into another business that would be selling fast foods with the help of her sister. 

She is applying for a loan of 1500 Soles. She thanks all the people who make her loan possible because she feels sure she will advance her business. With the loan she will buy lots of different brands and flavours of fizzy drink, as well as fruits, plastic bags and sugar for making the ice lollies.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, fruits, plastic bags and sugar.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia nació en la comunidad de Pasto Grande y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Pasto Grande está ubicado a 45 minutos de la  ciudad de Paucartambo). Ella tiene 46 años de edad y es madre y padre  para sus tres hijos de las cuales los tres todavía están a su lado. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana porque es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividad económicas son la venta de comida y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ella vende platos de comida desde muy temprano en uno de los mercados de la ciudad en donde tiene un puesto de venta, ella vende comida los días lunes a sábado pero los días domingos lleva a vender carne  a la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas.
texts.en:
Cecilia was born in the Pasto Grande community and still lives there. Pasto Grande is located 45 minutes from the city of Paucartambo. 

She is 46 years old and is mother and father to her three children that live with her. She belongs to the group Santa Isabel de Jajahuana and she is a responsible and enterprising person. She sells food and raises small animals, like guniea pigs and hens, for sale.

She sells plates of food beginning early in the morning in one of the markets in the city where she has a small stall. She sells food from Monday to Saturday. On Sundays, she sells meat in the city of Cusco.

This loan will allow her to buy hens.

loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Las Azucenas De Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, Las Azucenas de Xenacoj, is happy to participate in the Friendship Bridge program. It helps both the younger and older members of the Trust Bank to overcome obstacles and realize progress. They look forward to the increased revenue that they will earn in order to support their families.

Mayra is a single, 19-year-old woman with seven siblings. She is a first-year nursing student and looks forward to a successful nursing career. As her family does not have the financial resources to fund her education, Myra is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge for her textile business. She will use her loan to purchase yarn and thread to create beautiful pieces to sell. In this way, she can take care of her educational expenses and any additional ones as well.

Mayra looks forward to earning her nursing degree. She is most aware of the need for medical personnel in her community, both in small clinics and health centers. As she speaks both Spanish and her local Mayan dialect, she feels that she will be an asset to the people whom she will serve. She looks forward to serving her patients with understanding and compassion. Mayra will work at her business during the week and has scheduled her nursing classes over the weekends.

Mayra and the rest of the ladies of Las Azucenas de Xenacoj, are so pleased and excited to receive a microloan. With this special opportunity, they will be able to improve their own lives and the lives of their family members. The community will progress, as well. Mayra will play a significant role in the future of the town.

loans.use: To purchase yarn and thread to create beautiful textiles to sell, which will help her to finance her nursing studies

loans.name: San Miguel Xenacoj Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, San Miguel Xenacoj from Santo Domingo Xenacoj, is applying for their second loan with Friendship Bridge. The Trust Bank was established last year and consists of seven members whose average age is 44 years. Their families consist of an average of four children, and their average education lasted 2.7 years. Most of the ladies work on backstrap looms creating beautiful textiles, while a few are the owners of small storefronts. Their businesses really make a positive impact on the economies of their families.

Dominga is a 40-year-old member of the Trust Bank. She is married and has four children (three girls and one boy). Dominga owns a storefront, which she has had for few years. She was pleased to invest her first loan from Friendship Bridge in her business. She mentioned that before making a final choice about her current business, she explored other options. However, she decided that having a storefront business was a good fit for her and her family. It is located in a small room of her house, so she can attend to it from home. This business has helped Dominga to support her children, and they help her with small jobs or assisting her in the business.

This is Dominga's second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge, and her first with Kiva. She feels very grateful to have this monetary support that allows her to grow financially. She plans to buy more inventory for her business and will purchase useful items like rice, sugar, vegetables, canned goods and other products that are in great demand. In this way, she can continue serving her current clients and attract new ones.

The women of the Trust Bank, San Miguel Xenacoj, would like to thank Kiva investors for this valuable opportunity to secure a loan. In this way, they feel that they are on a progressive path that will lead to a better future for themselves, their families and their communities

loans.use: to buy inventory for her storefront grocery.

loans.name: Gracinda

texts.en: Gracinda is taking a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and secondhand bags. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa,  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, posee tres años de realizar esta actividad y lo hace todos los días. Ella tiene 38 años de edad y está casada, su esposo tiene 41 años y disfruta de tres hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 8, 12 y  15  años, ellos se dedican a estudiar.
El préstamo que necesita le permitirá comprar lociones, crema para la piel y diversidad de ropa para que los clientes tengan facilidad para elegir; este le ayudara a obtener más ingresos  y asimismo incrementar sus inventarios.
Su sueño es fortalecer más su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, works selling beauty products. She has been doing this for three years and she works everyday. She is 38 years old and married. Her husband is 41 and they have three children aged 8, 12 and 15 years who are studying. 

The loan she needs will allow her to buy lotions, skin cream and a variety of clothing so the customers have lots of choice; this will help her earn better profits and also increase her stock. 

Her dream is to strengthen her business further and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions, skin cream and a variety of clothes.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en: Olinda is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, So Klin soaps, biscuit seasoning, pens and hair combs. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $250. Olinda is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, So Klin soaps, biscuit seasoning, pens and hair combs.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2001 with her own working capital of $500.  She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is taking a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep and sell in her store, such as cigarettes, water, coffee, sugar, salt, bread, milk, fish, and soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta). She opened her kiosk a year ago, using her own working capital of $500. Eva is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy inventory to sell at her store, including cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, bread, milk, fish and soft drinks

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married. She is running a business in her house by selling kitchen materials. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living a town nearby the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk in 1997 with her working capital of $300. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy kitchen materials.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is taking a loan of $ 600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better after she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep and sell in her store, such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store, including second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is taking out a loan of $600 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy items to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, coffee, noodles, and biscuits. She opened her kiosk 2010 with her own working capital of $200.  She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, coffee, noodles, and biscuits

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is 25 years old, married and has one infant-age child. He aims to improve their status of living to give his family a better life. In this regard, he planned to improve his tailoring business to generate sufficient income and satisfy his family's needs. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy threads, a pin cushion, fabric, needles and hook and eye needed in the tailoring shop. He believes that this loan will enable him to improve the business and is hoping that someday, he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy threads, a pin cushion, fabric, needles and hook and eye needed in his tailoring shop.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in her house by selling noodles, tiger beer, Aqua, cooking oil, cigarettes, etc. She is making a good income, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with her working capital of $800.

loans.use: to buy noodles, tiger beer, Aqua, cooking oil, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. They live in Panglao, Bohol, Philippines. Andresa has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 25 years now. She is also in a food-vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Andresa is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs and additional ingredients for her food-vending business like flour, sugar, milk and butter. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business, and eventually, her income. In the future, Andresa has hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs and additional ingredients for her food-vending business like flour, sugar, milk and butter.

loans.name: 01.12.02 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business selling food and drink. She is requesting a loan to purchase food and drink to resell.

Thủy is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Thủy is the group leader of the 01.12.02 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase food and drink to resell

loans.name: Mubarik Ali

texts.en: Mr. Mubarik Ali is a 31 year old man who lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He is the father of 5 children. He purchases a variety of plastic and iron then resells it at a profit. He is making a good income from this business. He wants to increase his business by purchasing a wider variety of products for the shop. He has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes that the loan will be a productive one for his business. He is very grateful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase plastic and iron to resell.

loans.name: Imtiaz Alam

texts.en:
Mr. Imtiaz Alam is a 50 year old man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He is the father of 4 children. All of them are studying in a government school. He has been running a hardware shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for the family but his income is not enough to fulfill the needs of his family. He is a very hardworking, honest and responsible shopkeeper, father and husband. 

Presently he is in need of purchasing  paint, pipes, PVC pipe, joints, sanitation accessories, and screw drivers to sell. He has requested a loan of 120,000Pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to increase his net income and savings. He wishes for the successful future of his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for his hardware shop.

loans.name: Gulbaniz

texts.en:
Gulbaniz is a 39-year-old conservative married woman, so her husband has agreed to appear in the photo instead. 

Gulbaniz is a mother of three children. Her dream is a healthy life and an educated future for her children. To ensure constant income, she and her husband work at calf-raising and sell milk products. Now Gulbaniz wants to get a loan to expand their herd of livestock and then to build a bigger cattle barn. Her yard has a shed, and she stores the feed for animals together with the livestock there. 

Gulbaniz has applied for a loan to purchase two calves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves.

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga tiene 54 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en Chillanes Oprovincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

Olga María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol y mora. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Chillanes cada 8 días.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la producción y comprar los fertilizantes.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la pérdida y daños ocacionados por eventos climáticos. En el tiempo libre le gustasalir a pasear por el pueblo y la fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Olga is 54 years old, single, and has two children. She and her children live in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

The Communal Bank “Virgen de Baños” is established in the community of Mama Sara de Cerritos, which is located 30 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose.

Olga María is a farmer who grows corn, beans, and blackberries. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy compost, fertilizers, urea, and insecticides. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Chillanes every eight days.

With the help of this loan, Olga will be able to improve her production and buy fertilizers. The challenges she faces include dealing with losses and the occasional crop damage due to the weather. In her free time, Olga enjoys walking through town and taking in the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, urea, and insecticides.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is a 51year old widow and mother of two children. She operates a poultry farm that has been struggling because she has constantly had to withdraw all the profits and sometimes the capital to pay tuition for her children. Connie, who lives on the outskirts of the city, is also challenged by the high cost of poultry feed. Unfortunately, the price of chicken does not increase much. With this loan, she hopes that the status of her business will change and improve her income levels. She is a hard working woman.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and baby chicks.

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
Mr. Ramzan is 52 years old man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He has a large family that consists of 7 children and his wife. He has been running a small business to meet his household's needs. He purchases scrap plastic from sellers, categories it and resells it in the recycling factories. 

Mr. Ramzan has requested a loan of 100,000pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of material for the shop. This will help him to increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. He wishes for the good future of his children. He is thankful to the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for the great support.

loans.use: To purchase scrap plastic to sell in recycling factories.

loans.name: Yesenia Raquel

texts.es:
Yesenia, vive en la comunidad Las Canoas en las afueras de Boaco, casada  tiene 25 años de edad, tiene una niña de 2 años de edad y otra de 12 años, quien estudia en el colegio de la comunidad.   Yesenia posee una pulpería que vende arroz, azúcar, frijoles, gaseosas, pan, cosméticos y ropa interior.  Negocio que inicio ya hace cuatro años con dinero propio que tenía ahorrado de lo que le daba el marido quien labora como albañil o constructor de casas en general, es así como juntos salen a ganarse la vida a diario y sostienen a su familia.

Él está necesitando este crédito  para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite gaseosa y ropa interior para la venta.

Yesenia dice que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá invertir un poco más en la pulpería comprando más productos y así obtener más ganancias que le ayudaran a ir surtiendo más y mejorando  su casa  ampliando un poco más el local de la pulpería.
texts.en:
Yesenia, lives in the Las Canoas community on the outskirts of Boaco. She is 25 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old girl, and also a 12-year-old girl who studies at the local high school. 

Yesenia has a convenience store that sells rice, sugar, beans, soda, bread, cosmetics and underwear. It's a business she started four years ago with money she had saved that her husband gave her. He works as a bricklayer and general builder and this is how together they earn their living and support their family. 

This loan is needed to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, soda and underwear to sell. Yesenia says that the loan will help her as she will be able to invest a little more in the convenience store by buying more products. She will earn more profits that will help her continue to supply more and improve her house and grow the premises of the store a bit more.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, soda and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, rice, vegetables, and a bigger kitchen, among other products.

loans.name: Ana Lyd

texts.en: Due to a lack of job opportunities, Ana Lyd a 40-year-old mother who decided to put up a small bookstore in her community to generate income. She was blessed with only one child because she was separated from her husband due to unavoidable circumstances. Despite this, she has the determination to uplift their status of living. To start the business, she is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock of books to sell like dictionaries, encyclopedias, magazines and other reference books to sell. She is hoping that her loan will help her improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of books to sell.

loans.name: Eugenio De Jesus

texts.es:
Eugenio, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, frijol y maiz para generar ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar. El tiene 60 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto con sus seis hijos; este oficio lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 6: 00 am a 12: 00 pm, lo aprendió el trabajo con sus padres y tiene 25 años de realizarlo en lo propio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar 4 sacos de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas para llevar a cabo la siembra del cultivo. Esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar la capacidad de inversión y mejorar su rentabilidad. 
Su sueño es mejorar los ingresos para optimizar su situación económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenio grows basic grains, beans, and corn in order to generate income and to cover the household expenses.  He is 60 years old, and he lives in his own house with his six children.  He does this work from Mondays through Saturdays from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.  He learned this work with his parents, and he has been doing it on his own for 25 years.

The loan that he needs will allow him to buy four sacks of manure, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides in order to sow the crops.  This investment will help him to increase the investment capacity and improve its profitability.

His dream is to improve the income in order to optimize his financial situation with his family.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Aura Sonia

texts.es:
Aura de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de siete años de edad, a la cual desea ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida, apartada de toda carencia económica. Desde hace más de cinco años, después de padecer el abandono de su esposo, Aura inició con la venta de mercancía, actividad que realiza desde su vivienda y le permite realizar las labores domésticas y cuidar de su hija. Gracias a su trabajo hoy esta mujer puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.
Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante su familia y lograr posicionar su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos, debido a esto se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía (productos de uso personal y belleza).
texts.en:
49-year-old Aura is a single mother. She has a seven-year-old daughter who she wants to offer a better quality of life to, free from financial lack. 

For more than five years, after enduring the abandonment of her husband, Aura started selling merchandise, a job she does from her house that allows her to do the housework and look after her daughter. Thanks to her work, currently this woman can cover the household costs. 

Her greatest dream is to move her family forward and position her business to increase her income. Because of this she is applying for a loan to buy merchandise (products for personal use and beauty products).

loans.use: to buy merchandise (products for personal use and beauty products)

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco de 35 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y frijol y cuando ya esta lista su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, Francisco desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otras cosa que necesita para sus cultivos. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Francisco is 35 years old. He is a very responsible family man. He has always been known for giving his best to his children. 

He earns a living in agriculture, planting corn and beans. When the crop is ready he stores his harvest in the granaries shown in the photograph. 

He currently lives with his wife and their 4 children. He is a very hard-worker, and has always worked with joy and enthusiasm. 

Francisco would like to increase his sales and for this reason he is requesting a loan. The loan will allow him to buy: seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides among other things that he needs for his crops. 

He hopes to receive the help he is requesting because he does not have another source of income. This way he will continue putting bread on his family's table without limit.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en: Janepher is a single mother with two children. She deals in both agriculture and petty trading. She has undergone a hard life of raising her two children single-handedly with the meager income she earns from her businesses. However, she affirms that her hard work and being a social member in the community has enabled her to survive as a mother and a businesswoman. One of her children will be five years old next year, which will require her to look for tuition which may affect her future business capital. She has now applied for an early loan of 500,000 UGX to mulch her banana plantation and restock her business in preparation for her child’s education next year.

loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Zahid Ali

texts.en: Mr.Zahid Ali is a 30-year-old man. He lives in Punjab, Pakistan with his two children and wife. Since 2007, he has been running a small general store in the market. He works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan money, he will purchase a variety of goods, including rice, flour, milk, eggs, pulses, soap, and detergent for the store. This will help him to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children. Mr. Zahid Ali and his family are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: A 600 USD loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline used the previous loan to buy clothes. She is a 44-year-old lady living in Kagadi, Uganda. For five years now she has been selling clothes. She started as a hawker in different markets, then got capital and rented a shop. She also buys fabric and makes trendy designs. Her business is profitable. She says inadequate capital and price fluctuations are challenges affecting the business. She would like to educate her children, build a permanent house for her residence and hire employees to help expand the business. Caroline is requesting a loan to buy clothes for tailoring and resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for tailoring and resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis used the previous loan to buy shoes to sell. He is a married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years, he has been trading in second-hand shoes, and with the proceeds, he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. He is also a farmer who mainly grows bananas and beans. Inadequate capital is the factor affecting the business growth, while his dreams are to trade on a wholesale basis and educate his children up to the University. Francis intends to use the loan to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man, aged 41, and a father to six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a barber shop, and has been in this business for three years. He also does motorcycle transport to supplement his business. He is currently building a residential house for his family and dreams of educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. Inadequate capital is a major challenge to his business, while his dream is to own a modern salon in the city. John intends to use the loan to buy shaving machines to use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy shaving machines to use in the salon.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business for the past four years. His potential customers are neighbors and passers-by. He mentioned that two challenges for his business are stiff competition and a high cost of purchasing spare parts for maintenance.

With the loan, Omar wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future. Omar joined Yehu because of its responsiveness to customer needs. He appreciates the last Kiva loan that helped him to start a vegetable stall.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
MARIA TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADA TIENE SIETE HIJOS, VIVE CON EL ESPOSO Y LOS HIJOS EN  CHILLANE SPROVINCIA DE BOLÍVAR.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

MARIA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE FRÉJOL, MAÍZ, MORA, TOMATE, CAÑA, ADEMÁS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE GANADO.
 SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSECTICIDAS, UREA, FERTILIZANTES, HERBICIDAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO QUE LE HACE MUCHA FALTA. LOS DESAFÍOS A LOS QUE SE ENFRENTA SON LOS DESASTRES NATURALES.
EN SUEÑO ES MEJORAR LAS CONDICIIONES DE VIDA, TERMINAR DE EDUACR A LOS HIJOS Y DARLES UN BUENA VIDA.
EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PASEAR, VISITAR FAMILIARES, DEDICARCE A LA FAMILIA Y DISFRUTAR DE LAS FIESTAS DEL CANTÓN.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old. She is married and has seven children. She lives with her husband and children in Chillane, province of Bolivar.   

The VIRGEN DE BAÑOS communal bank was formed in the community of  Mama Sara de Cerritos, 30 minutes from the cooperative's office. 

Maria works in agriculture. She grows beans, corn, raspberries, tomatoes, and sugar cane. She also raises cattle. She is asking for the loan to buy insecticide, urea, fertilizer, and herbicides. With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy what she really needs. The challenges she faces are natural disasters.

Her dream is to improve her quality of life, finish raising her children, and giving them a good life. In her free time, she likes to go for walks, visit family and enjoys the festivals in her canton.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, urea, fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 42-year-old married man with eight children of which seven are of school-going age. A piggery farmer, he lives in Kagadi, Uganda, and has been in this business for five years. He also grows crops. He is also a teacher who was inspired in this business by a good lifestyle that he wanted to live compared to the poverty that he was born in. He dreams of building a good house for his family and educating his children up to the University. Joshua intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 38-year-old married woman with five children living in Hioma, Uganda. She sells new clothes in her shop but also takes them to specific office premises when her customers find it hard to come to her. She sells new bags, dresses, and shirts. She describes herself as hardworking and has a dream of educating her children up to the university level despite inadequate capital which hinders the growth of her business. Annet is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 31-year-old married man with two children living in Hioma, Uganda. He describes himself as a hardworking man. He operates a produce business dealing in maize, beans, and groundnuts, and he has operated it for a period of five years now. The business is urban-based and he started it using capital from farming to enable him to get daily income to help with the smooth running of his family. He would like to expand the business to new areas and buy a vehicle for transporting his produce to the city. Peter intends to use the loan to buy beans, groundnuts, and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, groundnuts, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 50-year-old businesswoman. She is married and a mother of three children. She has been running her retail shop for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 8,900, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing client.  

She will use the loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour, stationery, etc. With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her children. 

Her hope and dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, stationery, etc.

loans.name: Florensia

texts.en: Florensia is now applying for a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of USD 90.  She earns a good income from her business.

loans.use: to buy sandals, cigarettes, biscuits, and soft drinks

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, aged 38 years, is married and has been blessed with seven children. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a tailoring business, making dresses for women and suits for men. Her potential customers are neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inadequate capital in the business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread, and needles. She joined Yehu because it is responsive to customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread, and needles.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en: Laurent is a 37-year-old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a grade three teacher and has been in service for seven years. His love for community sensitization drove him into the profession despite the fact that it comes with a low salary. He wishes to venture into farming to supplement his earnings and also upgrade in his studies. Laurent intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 56 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 22 años. El tiene una fábrica de chichas, que inició su esposa cuando preparaba chicha de arroz, entre vecinas de su cuadra. Cuando Ismael dejó de ser conductor de buses intermunicipales, observó en esta actividad, un potencial de crecimiento y de sostenibilidad en sus ingresos para beneficiar su hogar. Así fue que empezaron a hacer chichas en mayor volumen y así mismo a buscar mercados para comercializarla; sus primeros clientes fueron las tiendas de los barrios cercanos y poco a poco fueron posicionándose, vendiendo el producto por cajas, como en la actualidad lo hace. Así mismo su hermana que vive en otra ciudad y se dedica al comercio de productos lácteos, le propuso vender queso, suero y carne, y con su apoyo, pues le otorgó crédito, Ismael le compró sus primeros productos e inició la venta de estos también, en la ciudad de Cartagena; con ellos le ha ido bien, pues hace pedidos semanales y vende nuevos productos que complementan su ingreso familiar. Ismael    con su credito anterior a la Fundaci´n Mario Santo Domingo, compró carne de res y mucho pescado que vendió, porque aumentó sus inventarios y  su clientela. Ismael dice a la Funación: “Gracias por su colaboración y que siempre lo sigan haciendo. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva,  con el cual comprará nuevamente carne porcina en mayor volumen pues es el producto de mayor volumen de ventas tiene y genera ingresos inmediatos, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Ismael is 56 years old. He lives in the city of Cartagena with his spouse and 3 children, aged 18 to 22. He has a chicha factory. He started when his wife would make rice chica with the neighbors on their block. When Ismael left is job as an inter-city bus driver, he observed in that activity a potential for growth and sustainability in his income to benefit his home. that was how they started to make chicha in greater quantities as well as to seek markets to sell it in. His first customers were the stores in the nearby neighborhoods. Little by little they gained ground, selling the product by the case, as they do now. His sister who lives in another city also has a business selling dairy products. She proposed that he sell cheese, whey and meat. With her support, because she made him a loan, and Ismael bought his first products from her and started selling those things as well in the city of Cartagena. It has gone well for him with these, because he makes weekly orders and sells new products that supplement the family income. With the previous loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, Ismael bought beef and a lot of fish that he sold because he increased his inventory and his customers. Ismael tells the Foundation: “Thanks for helping and I hope you continue to do it." Right now he is applying for his first Kiva loan, with which he will buy pork again in a larger quantity because it is the product that he sells the most and it generates immediate income, which will make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of pork.

loans.name: Isledy Del Socorro

texts.es: Isledy de 62 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, los cuales debió educar y sacar adelante debido a que su esposo falleció desde hace 26 años. Con el propósito de garantizarles educación y mejores condiciones de vida, esta mujer laboró como operaria en un taller de confecciones por largos años, pero por motivos de salud se retiró y se dedicó a las labores del hogar. Desde hace un año decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercancía desde su vivienda, con el fin de generar ingresos para su manutención. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos y comprar algunos encargos solicitados por sus clientes. Su mayor sueño es montar su propia tienda de ropa y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en: Isledy is 62 years old and has two children, whom she raised and educated on her own after her husband died 26 years ago. With the goal to ensure their education and better living conditions, Isledy worked at a sewing shop for many years, but for health reasons she retired and dedicated herself to household activities. A year ago she decided to make a living selling merchandise from her home, with the goal to generate income to support herself. She is requesting the loan to expand her product portfolio and buy some products requested by her customers. Her biggest dream is to set up her own clothing store and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, accessories and footwear.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela, de 36 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño , vive en su casa propia a lado de su familia conformada por sus hermanos, sus padres,su esposo y su hijo.Angela se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir de distintos sexos, modelos, tamaños y colores principalmente para niños. De manera periódica realiza la compra de su mercadería la misma que pone a la venta entre sus amigos, vecinos, familiares y otras personas conocidas bajo el sistema de venta crediticia. Realiza el cobro de manera diaria, semanal o quincenal dependiendo del acuerdo al que haya llegado con sus clientes. Trabaja sola en este rubro desde hace 8 años generalmente por las tardes. Le agrada mucho trabajar vendiendo prendas de vestir porque le permite conocer nuevos clientes y generar sus propios ingresos en sus ratos libres, ha visto que las ganancias son muy buenas y es por eso que desea consolidar con el paso del tiempo una pequeña tienda de venta de ropas en algún local o en su vivienda con una mejor infraestructura que le ayuden a mostrar mejor todo lo que ofrece. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 800 soles, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de prendas de vestir conformada por polos, jeans, pantalones, blusas, camisas y shorts para ponerlos a la venta entre sus clientes.
texts.en: Angela is 36, married and has a young son. She lives in her own home alongside her family, which consists of her brothers, her parents, her husband and their son. Angela makes a living selling distinct styles, colors and sizes of clothing, primarily for children. She periodically buys her merchandise herself and sells it to friends, neighbors, relatives and other acquaintances through her system of credit. She has been in this trade for eight years and generally works in the afternoon. She really enjoys selling clothes because it allows her to meet new customers and generate her own income in her free time. She has seen good profits and it's for this reason she wants to consolidate the business into a small clothing store at some site or out of her home since better infrastructure will help her better display what she has to offer. Angela is requesting the loan and is very grateful for the opportunity to have the financial support she needs to make headway. She plans to purchase a batch of clothes consisting of polos, jeans, pants, blouses, shirts and shorts to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase polos, jeans, pants, blouses and other clothes.

loans.name: Arquimides David

texts.es:
ARQUIMIDES TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO NO TIENE HIJOS, VIVE CON PADRES EN CHILLANES PROVINCIA DE BOLÍVAR.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

ARQUIMIDES SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE FRÉJOL, MORA, ADEMÁS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA  DE GANADO.

SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR SEMILLAS, UREA, HERBICIDAS, FERTILIZANTES. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRE´DITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO NECESARIO PARA LAS SIEMBRAS. LAS COMPRAS LAS REALIZARÁ EN CHILLANES.

EL SUEÑO ES TENER TERRENOS PROPIOS PARA SEMBRAR. lOS DESAFÍOS A LOS QUE SE ENFRENTA SON LA PRESENCIA DE PLAGAS Y ENFERMEDADES EN LOS CULTIVOS.

EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA EL DEPORTE Y LAS FIESTAS DE LA COMUNIDAD.
texts.en: Arquimides is 25 years old, single and doesn't have children. He lives with his parents in Chillanes, province of Bolivar. He is part of the Virgen de Baño community bank in the community of Sara de Cerritos, 30 minutes from the co-op's office. Arquimides makes a living growing beans and blackberries, and also raises livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea, herbicides and fertilizers that he needs for his crops. He will make the purchases in Chillanes. His dream is to have his own land to harvest. The challenges he faces is the presence of plagues and sicknesses in his crops. In his free time he likes sports and community festivals.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a single woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is employed as an assistant community development officer and has been in this service for two years. She joined the service to help give people skills, and she has been a source of inspiration to her community. She has a dream of upgrading her studies and buying land. Her main challenges are low pay and high cost of transport to reach the office. Her business plan is to buy land for farming. 

Zaina intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle repair service.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy vegetables, such as carrots and potatoes. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with working capital of $500. Maria is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has a single child. Ahmad is the only provider for his family.
Ahmad has owned a small bakery since 2010. He specializes in making bread and pastries. He has gained much experience. Ahmad has been able to hire 2 employees already and is rapidly growing with fame and respect in his neighborhood.
Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a new oven to improve his productions. Ahmad aims through this loan to improve his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new oven to improve his baking production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and married to Samson. They are blessed with ten children, four of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past five years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. Beatrice dreams of establishing rental houses in the future.
With the loan, she wants to expand into a transport business and purchase motorcycle for business. 
She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to use in transport.

loans.name: Aziida

texts.en: Aziida is a 38-year-old married woman with 2 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 15 years ago she decided to start a clothing shop in order to help meet the daily expenses of her family. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business growth, while her dreams are to trade in wholesale and educate her children to attain degrees. Aziida intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann earns a living through her hog raising business. She is a married woman and a mother of four children from Panglao, Bohol. Mary Ann is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income. Furthermore, Mary Ann wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una señora soltera de 46 años, tiene dos hijos hombres con  quienes vive en el municipio de Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la producción agrícola (repollo) desde hace 7 años, eligió esta actividad porque le gusta,  ya que invierte su capital y así obtiene  mejores  ganancias,  por lo que de esta manera aporta a la economía familiar. Realiza una segunda actividad que es la compra venta de verduras.
Está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para capital de trabajo para cultivo de papa con el objetivo de diversificar su producción agrícola  y de esta forma obtener más ingresos económicos. 
Su sueño es construir su casa más grande y de mejor calidad, ya que actualmente vive en 2 cuartos pequeños.
texts.en: Sabina is 46 years old, single and has two sons who live in the municipality of Sololá. She has made a living growing cabbage for the past seven years. She chose this activity because she enjoys it. She invests her capital and thus earns better profits, and in this way she supports the family finances. She also makes extra income buying and selling vegetables. She is requesting the loan to have capital to grow potatoes, with the goal of diversifying her agricultural production and increasing her income. Her dream is to build a bigger home of higher quality, since she currently lives in two small rooms.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Daysi Jhomayra

texts.es:
DAYSI TIENE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERA NO TIEME HIJOS, VIVE CON LOS PADRES EN CHILLANES PROVINCIA DE BOLÍVAR.

LA VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS ESTÁ FORMADA POR EN LA COMUNIDAD MAMA SARA DE CERRITOS, A UNA DISTANCIA DE 30 MINUTOS DE LA OFICINA DE LA COOPERATIVA

DAYSI SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAÍZ, FRÉJOL, ADEMAS SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE CERDOS Y POLLOS.

SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR SEMILLAS, UREA, INSECTICIDAS, HERBICIDAS. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO NECESARIO PARA LA AGRICULTURA. LAS COMPRAS LO REALIZARÁ EN CILLANES.

EL SUEÑO ES COMPRAR TERRENO. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA PASEAR Y VISITAR A LA FAMILIA.
texts.en: Daysi is 20 years old, single and has no children. She lives with her parents in Chillanes, province of Bolivar. She is a member of the Virgen de Baño community bank in the community of Mama Sara de Cerritos, 30 minutes from the offices of Cooperativa San Jose. Daysi makes a living growing corn and beans, as well as raising pigs and chickens. She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides and herbicides, which are necessary for her crops. She will make the purchases in Chillanes. Her dream is to buy land. In her free time she likes to go for walks and visit with family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a business from her house selling diesel and petrol. She is making a good income from selling iesel and petrol and she wants to buy more quantity with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with a working capital of $100.

loans.use: to buy diesel and petrol.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe, 58 years divorced, has been blessed with nine children all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling charcoal to her neighbours. In addition she also operates a green grocery business, which earns her extra. She cites the high cost of transportation to be her major challenge in this. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan Kwekwe wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Mrgavan village of the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, daughter, who is 19 years old and two sons (7 and 9 years old). Together with her husband, Anahit cultivates land and grows apricot trees. 

Anahit's husband goes abroad during the winter season and financially supports the family. Their daughter Qnarik is a student at the Armenian State Economic University and specializes in accounting.
 
As the family's monthly income is hardly enough to cover daily costs, it is very difficult for Anahit to save money for Qnarik's education.

Anahit has requested this loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition. The loan will help Qnarik to complete her education and become a good specialist. She dreams of finding a good job and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Nelly,  quien con su anterior credikiva compró materias primas, con las cuales elaboró ricos pasteles trifasicos (carne-pollo-cerdo) y como aumentó su producción, logro incrmentar su clientela. En su negocio ya no compra a crédito y su vida está muy bien, ella dice a sus finaciadores que muchas gracias porque su crédito es mas económico que en otras organizacines . Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, pues los colombianos celebramos tambien,  el dia internaionalde las madres y esta época es muy comercial y se aumentan los ingresos de su familia, por concepto de ventas de sus productos. Con su nuevo credikiva comprará insumos, materias primas para elaborar deliciosas comidas, a fin de que las madres y todas las  clientes estén muy felices en este dia, alimentandose bailando y disfrutando en familia con los pasteles que prepara Nelly.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Nelly, who with her previous Kiva loan purchased supplies to make her delicious "pasteles trifasicos" (pastries made with meat, chicken and pork) and increase her production and her customer base.  She still doesn't buy on credit and her life is going very well. She says thank you very much to her lenders because the loan is more affordable than through other organizations.
