texts.en:
Elga is 30 years old, married and has two children.  She lives in a home of her own with her children and husband.  Together they do what they need to provide the best quality of life.  Elga sells charcoal.  She works from her home, where she sets up a table for her bags that she has acquired from another town.  She buys in large sacks that provide her enough for more than 50 small bags that she resells.  She buys approximately five sacks per week, for about 100 PEN each time.  She has had this business for more than four years and things are going well.  She enjoys her work because it generates an income of her own from the comfort of her home where she can also do the work necessary to care for her home.  She has learned to do both.  She wants to set up a larger location so she can have more bags of charcoal and improve her income.  She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN and is grateful to those who make this loan possible so that she can complete her goals.

She will use the money to buy two sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells charcoal at the market on both wholesale and retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to help with transportation and to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Umu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 5,800,000 Sierra Leonean leones for the entire team in order to meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Umu, who is pictured on the right, is the featured leader of this group. The 53-year-old is a native of Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. She is a widow and has three children who are no longer attending school. Umu has been a professional teacher for 28 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, iron rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets, sand, nails, iron rods, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy small appliances and provisions

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela de 40 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 17 años. Ella tiene un restaurante en compañía de su esposo, y también produce productos de panificación. Su negocio inició hace 15 años cuando capitalizó la idea de su esposo, de ser independiente mediante una microempresa.  Durante todos estos años han logrado tener una buena clientela, especialmente entre los miembros de la policía nacional, pues su negoció se encuentra ubicado justo al frente de esas instalaciones. Además de estos negocios también tiene un café internet, donde ofrece servicios de comunicaciones y de fotocopiaje, aprovechando el potencial de su clientela.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, para poder atender la demanda de los trabajadores de una construcción, que están haciendo frente al restaurante y requieren alimentos. En el mediano plazo planea convertir su negocio en un autoservicio, con aire acondicionado y un mayor confort, aunque su mayor desafío es la competencia fuerte que hay en el sector, pero la enfrenta exitosamente con un servicio de calidad e imagen de empresa y de empresario y con mucha disciplina de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ángela is 40 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and two children, aged 14 and 17. She owns a restaurant together with her husband and also produces bakery products. Her business started 15 years ago when she capitalised on her husband's idea of becoming independent by means of a micro-finance institution.

During all these years she has managed to build up a good clientèle, especially within the members of the national police service, as her business is located just in front of their buildings. 

Apart from this business she also runs an internet café, where she offers communication and photocopying services, making the most of the potential of her clients. At present she is requesting a loan, her first loan cycle with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy food stocks in order to be able to meet the needs of construction workers, who are working in front of the restaurant, and need feeding.

In the medium term, she plans to convert her business into a self service, with air conditioning and greater comfort. However, her biggest challenge is the strong competition that exists in her area. She deals with this effectively by offering quality service and a good business image. She is a good businesswoman and is very disciplined.

loans.use: to buy food stocks in order to prepare food.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo que es agricultor; ella posee una pequeña tienda donde vende golisinas de todo tipo, juegos, entre otras cosas, tiene muchos años con su negocio, lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión para poder surtir con productos su pequeña tienda pero necesita de capital ya que con las ganancias que obtiene solo alcanza ha solventar sus gastos familiares por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su pequeña tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Eugenia is 62 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, who is a farmer. She owns a small shop where she sells all types of sweets, games, among other things. She has had her business for many years. It is located in her house and is well known by her neighbours.

Eugenia wants to extend her business and invest in order to be able to stock her small shop but she needs capital as the only earnings she receives just about cover the family expenses. This is why she is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy necessary things for her small shop. She states that she will pay back the loan and trust that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sweets, juices, etc.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.es:
Delfin, es casado y tiene dos hijos que estan en colegio , viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Ajlla de la localidad de Achacachi de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz.
Delfin estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche, además es acopiador de una de las empresas que recolectan leche en el área rural de La Paz  en la localidad de Achacachi.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de ganado mejorado (tres vacas), de esta manera mejorará  su producción de leche y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Delfin es tener su propio centro de acopio.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Delfin is married and has two children who are in high school. They live in their own home which is located in the Ajlla community of the town of Achacachi in the Omasuyos province, department of La Paz.

Delfin went to school up to the secondary level and right now he works in milk production. He is also a collector for one of the businesses that collect milk in the rural area of La Paz in the town of Achacachi.

He needs the loan to buy better quality cattle (three cows). This way, he will improve his milk production and thus improve his quality of life. 

Delfin's dream is to have his own collection center. This is the third time he has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy three dairy cows of better quality to increase high quality milk production.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE – 26 está compuesta por ocho integrantes de los cuales cinco son mujeres y tres varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Lupe tiene 28 años,  tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años ella confecciona ropa de trabajo, overoles,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona del Achachicala, la Sra. Lupe va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que ella tiene contratos con empresas a los que entrega el producto terminado,  como también entrega a distintas ferias donde venden ropa de trabajo,   la Sra. Lupe enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes,  la Sra. Lupe es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE – 26 communal bank is made up of eight members, five women and three men. THey work in different activities. The president of the bank is Lupe. She is 28. She has two children who are school aged. She has worked making clothing for several years. She makes work clothes and overalls. Her workshop is in her house. located in the Achachicala area. Lupe is going to use this loan to buy fabric wholesale to make clothing. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her investment capital, since she has contracts with businesses to which she delivers the finished product. She also delivers to different markets where they sell work clothes. Lupe faces challenges in her business, such as increasing her income. She is going to use her profits to invest in buying sewing materials to make good quality clothing and thus have more orders from her customers. Lupe is a very hardworking person who is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has given.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Jaguar Group

texts.en:
Hamadi, who is in his late 50s, is married with two children who go to school.  He has been running a retail shop for two years now. He works from 6:30 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hamadi's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the retail shop and has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees and started building his house. He will use this loan to restock the missing items in the retail shop. His dream is to one day be able to continue building and finish his house.

Hamadi will share this loan with his loans group "Jaguar" consisting of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in their retail shop.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Bonifacia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and its harvest. In the future, Bonifacia hopes to make her business successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Mkrtich

texts.en:
Mkrtich is 40 years old. He lives in Akhaltsikhe District with his parents, two children and wife. Mkrtich requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Mkrtich’s father serves the local people as a taxi driver and gets a small monthly income, and his mother is provided with a retirement pension. Mkrtich has a grocery store locally. There is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. 

The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Mkrtich will purchase a stock of groceries for his grocery store. After the stock is purchased he will be able to offer more varieties of products to his customers. As the customers will be more satisfied, he will increase his income and will reinvest in the same business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries for his grocery store

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa, es soltera y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la Urb. 16 de febrero  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel primario y actualmente se dedica al comercio de condimentos (ají de varias calidades, comino, pimienta, etc.) en la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para refacción de su vivienda (necesita arreglar las paredes que son de adobe, comprar estuco para planchar las paredes)de esta manera tener una mejor calidad y nivel de vida.
El sueño de Felipa es terminar de construir su casita.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Felipa is single and does not have any children who depend on her. She lives in her own house which is located in the estate 16th February in the city of El Alto. Felipa studied up to primary level and currently makes a living selling spices (various types of chili, cumin, pepper, etc.) in the city of El Alto.

She is requesting this loan to renovate her house. She needs to fix the walls which are made of mud and buy plaster to smooth the walls. This will give her a better quality of life.

Felipa's dream is to finish building her house.

This is her first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy plaster to renovate the mud walls of her house.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 26 years old. He lives in Akhaltsikhe District with his 26-year-old wife and two children, who are going to school. Revaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Revaz has his own car washing service. He is working there and washes cars to earn a small income for the family which is not enough to cover their monthly expenses.

Revaz requested a loan from Credo to restart a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Revaz will start trading clothes and household goods. He will purchase the products from the big market at the wholesale price and resell them among the villagers with a price markup. Revaz used to have this business before, and he is very experienced in this field. This will help him to restart up his business and make it successful. He will earn good profit which will be used for reinvesting and developing the business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start trading clothes and household goods

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 40-year-old, hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a government employee, and Rani has a part-time business of a photo studio in her house. Rani wants to educate her children in good schools, and that’s why she is running a photo studio to generate an alternative source of income for her family.

Currently, Rani is in need of purchasing new digital cameras and some accessories like batteries, etc., so that she can run her business more appropriately and satisfy her clients more professionally. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She will also renovate her photo studio with the loan which will attract more clients. With the profit, she wants to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase cameras for a photostudio

loans.name: Fredesbinda

texts.es: Fredesbinda, de 47 años de edad ,esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia con quienes comparte el mismo amor por el trabajo y el anhelo por lograr una buena calidad de vida.Fredesinda se dedica al cuidado de niños pequeños. Ha establecido en su vivienda una guardería con los elementos básicos para la protección y tranquilidad de los niños. Su labor consiste en cuidarlos mientras sus padres trabajan brindándoles momentos de recreación con juegos didácticos, alimentación y educación. Lleva realizando esta actividad por más de 5 años. Eventualmente se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y bebidas energizantes. Su trabajo le genera ganancias considerables por semana lo que le sirve para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y destinar otra parte al ahorro para alguna situación fortuita.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles , por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cuotas de manera puntual .Con el monto solicitado comprará juegos didácticos, materiales educativos y sillas pequeñas para seguir recibiendo más niños para su cuidado.
texts.en:
Fredesbinda is 47 years old, married and has three children. She lives in her own house together with her family, who share the same love for their work and the desire to obtain a good quality of life. Fredesbinda makes a living caring for young children. She set up a nursery in her house with the basic elements necessary for the safety and tranquillity of the children. Her job consists in looking after them while their parents work. She gives them moments of free play time with didactic games, food and education. She has carried out this activity for more than five years. If necessary, she makes a living selling fizzy drinks and energy drinks. Her job generates considerable earnings every week, which helps her cover their basic needs and put some money away as a saving for when needed.

On this occasion she is requesting 1500 PEN and would like to thank all the people who make this loan possible so she can go ahead with her plans. On the other hand, she is committed to making her loan payments on time. With the amount requested she will buy didactic games, educational materials and small chairs so she can continue caring for more children.

loans.use: to buy didactic games, educational materials and small chairs.

loans.name: Anaiz

texts.es:
Anaiz de 56 años de edad, es madre cabeza de familia de siete hijos. Laboró durante 18 años como fotógrafa en el departamento de Caquetá, Colombia, pero debido a los desastres naturales ocurridos en esta región se vio en necesidad de desplazarse, debido a que perdió su vivienda y su negocio, el cual era su única fuente de ingresos. A raíz de esta situación se ubicó en la ciudad e Medellín en donde comenzó a vender fritos y tamales, para la supervivencia de su familia. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, lo cual resulta más conveniente por su actual estado de salud.
Con el propósito de mejorar su condición económica y garantizarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación, Anaiz se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de una vitrina que usará como exhibidor de mercancía.
texts.en:
Anaiz is 56 years old. She is mother to seven children and head of the household. She worked as a photographer in the department of Caquetá, Columbia for 18 years, but due to natural disasters in this region she was forced to move. She lost her house and her business, which was her only source of income. In the wake of this situation, she settled in the city of Medellín, where she began to sell fried foods and tamales to help her family survive. Presently she makes a living selling products by catalogue, which is more convenient for her present state of health.

With the aim of improving her economic condition and ensuring her children receive a better quality of life and education, Anaiz is requesting a loan with which she will buy a display cabinet where she will display her products.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, es casado y tiene Un hijo que está en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa adela Amigo Chaco  de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente trabaja como chofer asalariado, en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, fierro. Así podrá construir una tienda para su esposa donde ella pueda comenzar un negocio de venta de abarrotes.
El sueño de Juan Carlos es tener su casita construida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is married and has a son who studies at a state school. He lives in his own house, which is located in the area Villa Adela Amigo Chaco in the city of El Alto.

Juan Carlos studies up to secondary level and is currently working as a paid chauffeur in the city of La Paz.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials: cement, bricks, iron. In this way he will be able to build a shop for his wife, where she can start up a business selling food stocks.

Juan Carlos' dream is to finish building his house.

This is his first loan cycle with IMPRO and his first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and iron to build a shop in his house.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Мубораку 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Муборак вместе семьей живет в сельской местности и поэтому ее местожительство весьма благополучный для скотоводства. Муборак после участие в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин решила организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота. Она имеет опыт выращивание скота, так как она с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству. Муборак планирует купить скот, присматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке по более высокой цене, чем она купила. Сын Муборака будет помогать ей введение бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота. Этот займ поможет ей организовать новый бизнес и таким образом найти нового источника дохода. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muborak is 50 years old, married and has 3 children.  She lives with her family in a rural area that is very good for cattle.  After taking the course To Get Ahead, offered by the Association of Business women, she decided to start her own business buying and selling animals.  She has previous experience in this field since her childhood when she helped her parents with their livestock.  Muborak plans on buying cattle, fattening them for a few months and then reselling them at a local market at a higher price then she paid for them.  Her son will help her driver conduct this business.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 KGS.  This loan will help her start her business and begin a new source of income.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade his construction business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, es casado y no tiene hijos dependientes , vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Juliana   de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente es prensista de imprenta independiente y realiza trabajos para varias imprentas.
El crédito lo requiere para al pago al Hospital donde se encuentra internada su esposa ya que tuvo una operación.
El sueño de Antonio es tener su propia imprenta.
Es la terceravez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Antonio is married and has no dependent children. He lives in his own house, which is located in the area Villa Juliana in the city of El Alto.

He studies up to secondary level and is presently working as a printer in an independent printing factory where he carries out various printing jobs.

He is requesting a loan to pay the hospital where his wife is admitted as she has had an operation.

Antonio's dream is to have his own printer.

This is his third loan cycle with IMPRO and his first time with KIVA.

loans.use: pay the hospital for the operation his wife received.

loans.name: Hanifamo

texts.ru: Ханифамо женщина с доброй душой. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ханифамо 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Муж Ханифамо трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и поэтому Ханифамо справляется с домохозяйством сама. Ханифамо более 2 года заниматься купле продажей индустриальных товаров на местном рынке. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов, и год за годом развивает бизнес. Ханифамо должна увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получать больше дохода, так как она нуждается в деньгах. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1050 долларов США для покупки товара как нитка, иголка, зеркало и т.п. для увеличения оборотного капитала. Это ее первый займ, и она надеется, что этот займ поможет ей развивать бизнес и таким образом принесет радость в ее дом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hanifamo is a 42-year-old, hardworking woman with a kind soul.  She's married and is raising 3 children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, so Hanifamo handles the household by herself.  She has more than 2 years experience selling industrial goods at a local market.  She has regular customers and each year she expands her business.  Hanifamo wants to increase her working capital and, in turn, increase her income since she is in need of money.  She's asking for a loan of $1050 to buy more goods like thread, needles, mirrors, etc., to achieve these goals.  This is her first loan and she hopes that it will help her develop her business which will bring joy to her home.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy home products to increase turnover

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru: Икромчон женатый молодой человек. Ему 27 лет. Он живет у родителей в районе Шахритус на юго-западе Таджикистана. Теплый и даже жаркий климат района благоприятствует здесь развитию сельского хозяйства. Икромчон намерен начать новый бизнес и выбрал животноводческую деятельность. У него имеется сарай для содержания скота, корм для скота и к тому же скотный рынок находится недалеко от его дома. Икромчон нуждается в кредите, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Он запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ikromjon is young, married man, 27 years of age.  He lives with his parents in Shahrituz region in southwestern Tajikistan.  The warm and even hot climate of the region is conducive to agriculture.  Ikromjon is going to start his own business and has chosen the livestock industry.  He has a barn to keep the animals, feed for them, and a livestock market is found not far from his home.  Ikromjon needs a loan to start this business buying and selling cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle.

loans.name: Action Women Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Action Women” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Seibatu. Seibatu is age 32. She was born in Kailahun Town in eastern Sierra Leone. She is currently residing in Kenema City, together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman. One of her children is attending primary school and the other one is not of school-going age. For many years now, Seibatu has been selling fish. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо 49 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 21 лет опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается куплей продажей продукты питания как конфеты, печенье и т.п. в продовольственном магазине. Она справляется с бизнесом одна, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и ей не на кого надеется. В последнее время у нее мало клиентов, так как конкуренция большая, и она не может придерживать своих клиентов, которые делают покупки в новых магазинах. Зебо должна срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы вернуть своих клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для того, чтобы купить хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки и молочные продукты. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zebo is 49 years old, married and is raising 1 child.  She is a very hardworking person and has more than 21 years of experience in business.  She buys and sells food products like candy and cookies in a store.  She handles her business alone since her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and she has no one to lean on.  The last little while, she has had few clients because of intense competition.  She is unable to hold on to her clients who shop at new stores.  Zebo urgently needs to expand her assortment of goods in order to bring back her clients.  She is asking for a loan of $3,000 in order to buy bread, butter, sausages, canned goods, beverages and dairy products.  She depends on you and your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food items as bread, butter, milk products and etc to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Aiten

texts.en:
Aiten is 36 years old. She lives in Marneuli District with her parents. Aiten requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays, the family is out of a source of income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Aiten requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Aiten will renovate a commercial space and open a clothes shop. After the commercial space is renovated, she will purchase clothes. Aiten hopes that this business will be profitable; she will do her best to satisfy the needs of her clients. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate a commercial space and open a clothes shop.

loans.name: Luis Daniel

texts.es: Graacias por apoyar a Luis, quien con su anterior credikiva compró mercancia con la cual respondio a las expectativas y necesidades de su clientela; el con su credito pudo apalancar su negocio, incrementar sus ventas, utilidades y capital de trabajo y esto se reinvirtió en que se pudo mejorar sus condiciones de vida, viajó a otra ciudad con su madre y se reencontró con su familia. Su negocio ha crecido y está muy fortalecido por eso envia el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadoes de Kiva " es de infinitos agradecimientos, y gratitud, por la labor de apoyar a las personas como yo, de escasos recursos, y que gracias a los préstamos podemos tener la oportunidad de progresar. " En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará mercancias variadas, y hará mantenimiento y reparación de vitrinas y del local comercial para darle una mejor presentación y así su mercancia exhibida será mas apetecida por su clientela., lo cual es el factor de éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Luis.  With his previous Kiva loan he bought merchandise in response to his customers’ expectations and needs.  With his loan he was able to leverage his business and increase his sales, profits, and working capital.  He used this to reinvest, and he was able to improve his living conditions.  

He traveled with his mother to another city, and he reunited with his family.  His business has grown and is much stronger.  That is why he sends the following message to his Kiva lenders, “It is with unending gratitude that I thank you for your work of supporting people like me with scarce resources.  Thanks to the loans we are able to have to opportunity to progress”.

He is currently applying for a new Kiva loan.  He will use the loan to buy varied merchandise.  He will also perform maintenance and repair the display cases at his place of business in order to give it a better presentation.  This way, his merchandise on display will be more appealing to his clientele.  This is the factor that will make this investment successful.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise, to perform maintenance, and to repair the display cases.

loans.name: Jesus Erminda

texts.es: Doña Jesus de 61 años de edad se dedica a la confeccion de ropa de todo tipo desde hace 13 años, vive con su esposo en casa propia, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien y deja la ropa a la medida que el cliente solicita, con las costuras que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar pero necesita hacerle unas mejoras a su vivienda la foto muestra parte de la casa donde quiere construir ya que con lo que gana no le es suficiente para realizarlo por eso solicita un credito para poder hacerle unas mejoras para que puedan vivir mas seguros ella y su esposo y asi poder tener la casa que siempre han querido pero por su estabilidad economica no han podido lograr hacerlo.
texts.en: Jesus is 61 years old and has worked as a tailor making all kinds of clothing since she was 13 years old. She lives together with her husband in their own home. She has a loyal clientele because she does  good work and tailors clothing to the requested measurements. With the tailoring she has done she has been able to cover some household expenses, but she needs to complete some improvements to the home. The photo shows part of the house where she would like to build. As what she earns is not enough to pay for construction outright, she is requesting this loan in order to complete the improvements. This way she and her husband will be able to live more securely and have the home they have always wanted but have not had the financial stability to afford.

loans.use: complete improvements to her home.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина женщина, которая старается помочь всем близким ее людям. Нигина с детства всегда мечтала стать богатой бизнес леди и это ее мечта стала толчком в ее жизни. Ей 54 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она воспитала и обеспечивала детей сама. Нигина хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей обуви, и в этом будет помогать ей ее сын. Она обратилась в ИМОН и участвовала на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин совместно с ИМОН. От данного курса она получила много новой информации. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки обуви. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей найти источника дохода и таким образом улучшить условию проживания. Она обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Nigina is a woman who tries to help all those close to her.  Since her childhood, she has dreamed of becoming a successful business woman and this goal has become and impetus in her life.  She is 54 years old, divorced and has 2 children.  She raised and provided for her family alone.  Nigina wants to start her own business buying and selling footwear--her son will be helping her.  She has turned to IMON to take part in the course To Get Ahead IMON offers in conjunction with the Women's Business Association.  She received much information from this course.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to buy footwear.  She awaits your kindness.  This loan will help her establish a source of income which will increase her standard of living.  She assures she will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy shoes to start a new business

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya is from Hartashen village, where she lives with her husband and twin sons (who are 12-years-old). Together with her husband, Nadya runs a farm which currently includes 13 cows, a pig, nine piglets and two calves. They also own agricultural land where they cultivate wheat, potatoes and beans. 
Nadya works hard and runs her farm with great love and pleasure. She does her best to gather a good harvest, and her husband sells it in the local market.
To be financially more stable, Nadya would like to enlarge her farm. She has requested this loan to purchase five calves and forage for feeding them. The loan is important for Nadya to expand her farm and get more income, which is very important for covering the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for five calves and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a lady of forty-seven years, married to Josphat and a mother of two children. She runs a cereals shop in Kangemi and has been doing so for nine years now. She gets a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

This will be Jane's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy different types of cereals in bulk. In the future, she wants to expand her business and even sell at wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals.

loans.name: Tatul

texts.en:
Tatul has been involved in agriculture for more than 16 years. He runs a farm which currently includes 2 cows, 7 calves, a mother pig and 10 little ones, 20 chickens, and 6 turkeys.

Tatul runs the farm with great love and pleasure and works hard to gather high income, which is vital for sustaining his family of six: his wife, son, daughter, and retired parents.

As it is very difficult for Tatul to cover farming costs and the family’s basic needs, he needs some financial support. Tatul has requested this loan to purchase forage for feeding the pigs and fertilizer for cultivation of fruits and vegetables. This loan is important for Tatul to enlarge his farming activities and gather more income.

Tatul wants his farm to be one of the best in the region and does his best to accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the pigs and fertilizer for cultivation of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Pilisika

texts.en:
Pilisika is 59 years old married to Samson. They have two children, aged 25 and 20 years old. She has been in the business of scrap metal for about four years, with a monthly income of about KES. 7,750. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy more scrap metals for sale to increase her profits. She hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metals for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah is 33 years old. She is a resident of the city outskirts, and is divorced with two children who both attend school. She never had enough education as she was forced to marry early because her parents could not continue paying her tuition because of poverty. Hanifah is in the business of poultry, which she started after divorcing with her husband in order to continue earning a living and be able to look after her children.

Hanifah acquired a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings in order to be able to sustain her business by acquiring more feeds such that she can be able to meet the increasing demand of her chickens.

She has a dream of being one of the leading business people in poultry rearing and being able to build her own a house and take her children to good schools.

She is a very hardworking lady who is self-motivated and has good relationships with the people around her.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Gaga

texts.en:
Gaga is 32 years old. He lives in Akhmeta Kutaisi district, West Georgia, with his wife and parents. Gaga requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.  Gaga works at a local wood workshop as an artisan. His mother works at the local grocery shop as a seller. They both get small monthly salaries which are barely enough to cover family monthly expenses. 
Gaga requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Gaga will start trading with wood materials himself. As he is already experienced in this field, Gaga will purchase wood materials at the wholesale price from Turkey at a low cost and sell them with a price markup to the resellers among his district.  He will use part of the profit for reinvesting in the same field and purchase more materials in order to develop the business. Gaga will use the rest for covering monthly expenses and providing better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To start trading with wood materials

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man and has four children aged between eight and twenty-two years. He operates a taxi business, which he has done for fifteen years. John also runs a grocery where he earns some extra income.

John plans to use the KES 30,000 loan to buy fuel and buy more stock for his grocery store so as to upgrade his business. He is financially constrained and plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and cater to other family needs. He is visionary and ambitious and hopes to own a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy fuel and buy more stock for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 42 years old and a widow. She has three children, aged 18, 16 and 12 years old. She has been running business of selling potato chips for a period of about four years with an income of about 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) a month. 

This is her second loan in KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use it to buy more potatoes and tomato sauce for her business. She hopes to have a successful business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and tomatoes sauce for her business.

loans.name: Maryann

texts.en: Maryann is a single lady of twenty six years.  She provides for her mother. She operates a cereals shop in Kangemi and has been in this business for four years now.  Maryann gets  a monthly income of forty thousand shillings. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy different types of cereals for sale. In the future, she wants to become a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase different types of cereals; eg., beans, rice and green grams

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy mints, sugar, chocolates, biscuits, etc. in a larger quantity to add to his business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La Sra. Laura sigue con la actividad de la venta de comida, y como refrigerios y sándwiches cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de refrigerador para conservar sus alimentos en buen estado,   creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida  como abarrotes y Aceite, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Laura continues with the business activity of selling food like snacks and sandwiches.  She says that it went very well for her with the last loan.  She used it to buy a refrigerator to keep her food fresh.  She grew in her business activity, and she got more customers.  That led to getting more income.

This time she requested the loan to buy supplies to make food.  She will buy things like groceries and oil.  She is happy and grateful for this new opportunity that is being given to her.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives with her husband (in the photo) and two sons (in the photo). 

Gayane's husband teaches at a local school, and Gayane runs a farm. She keeps 30 chickens, 30 lambs and a cow, and cultivates potatoes as well. 

Gayane works hard to gather a good harvest, sell it in the local market and help her husband to sustain the family. Unfortunately a teacher's salary is hardly enough for covering the family's basic costs, and agriculture helps the family to have a stable income.

Gayane has applied for this loan to purchase seeds for cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock, and to purchase fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. 

The loan is very important for Gayane and her husband to enlarge their farming business and gather more income, which is important for improving family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds for cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock, and to purchase fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market.

loans.name: Take And Pay Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Kambia town 58 years ago. He is married, and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending primary school, and the other is still not of school-going age.  Mohamed sells bags, and has been selling bags for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Mohamed and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mohamed will use his share of the loan (400,000 SLL) to buy a larger quantity of bags to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of bags to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Gharib

texts.en:
Gharib has been involved in agriculture for many years. He is the married father of three children. His wife is a teacher at a local school and Gharib runs a farm. His farm currently includes five cows and seven calves. Besides that, Gharib cultivates tomatoes, watermelon and melons. He works hard to bring in a good harvest, because the main source of the family's income is agriculture. 

Gharib has applied for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of fruits and vegetables, and three oxen. This will enable Gharib to cultivate more fruits and vegetables and to improve his livestock. Gharib hopes that with the help of this loan he will be able to enlarge his farming activities and ensure a better life for his beloved family.

loans.use: To pay for seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of fruits and vegetables, and three oxen

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es:
Teodocio, es concubino (no está casado pero vive con su pareja) y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar en un colegio estatal, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Franz Tamayo   de la ciudad de El Alto.
Teodocio estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la matriceria metálica (elabora matrices en metal para hacer diferentes artefactos) y arreglo de maquinaria pesada; además también se dedica  a la fabricación de puertas metálicas para garajes.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar un maquina de tornería de esta manera facilitar su trabajo que será una producción más limpia y que este sea más optimo.
El sueño de Teodocio es tener un taller más amplio.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Teodocio is in a common-law relationship (he is not married but lives with his partner), and he has two children who attend a state school. His house is located in the Franz Tamayo zone in the city of El Alto.

Teodocio studied up to secondary school, and he currently works making metal molds (he creates molds in metal to produce various items), and repairing heavy machinery. He also creates metal doors for garages. 

He needs the loan to buy a lathe machine, which will facilitate his work, optimizing his production and making it cleaner. 

Teodocio's dream is to have a larger workshop. 

This is the third time he is requesting a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a lathe machine which will help him in his work and make it cleaner.

loans.name: Together As One Iv Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Kenema city 42 years ago. He is married to a trader, and the couple has three children. One is attending primary school and the others are attending secondary schools.

For many years now, Mohamed has been selling biscuits, sugar, milk, cigarettes, mints, coffee, etc. With the help of this loan, Mohamed and his group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mohamed will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to expand his business. He will buy biscuits, sugar, milk, cigarettes, mints, coffee, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sugar, milk, cigarettes, mints, coffee, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.name: We Day Pay Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “We Day Pay” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 leones each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Jenneh is the featured leader of this group. This 35-year-old is married to a farmer and they have two children. Jenneh has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells fish. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a larger quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She has one additional family member, her father. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food.

Juliet has a retail shop. She has been in business for the last seven years. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation, the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda, and seasonality.

Juliet has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cooking oil, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked shop and to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.es: Silvestra es una microempresaria con mucho éxitos originaria de Masaya cuna del folklor nicaragüense, tiene 50 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora, es acompañada y tiene 15 años de dedicarse a  la venta de frutas  en el mercado de su localidad, tiene tres hijos adultos y la crianza de dos nietos de 3 y 5 años de edad, con el crédito anterior de sus ganancias compraron una yunta de buey y una carreta, su compañero es agricultor que siembra maíz, frijoles y flores que también los comercializa en el mercado. Sus sueños es siempre tener su negocio invertir más en productos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mandarinas, naranjas, aguacate, tamarindo, limón agrio, mango, jocote, papaya verde etc.
texts.en: Silvestra is a successful micro entrepreneur who comes from Masaya, home of Nicaraguan folklore. She is 50 years old, she has a life partner, she is hardworking and she has been engaging in selling fruits in the marker of her community for 15 years. She has three adult children and she cares for her two grandchildren, aged 3 and 5. She used her previous loan to buy a yoke of oxen and an oxcart. He life partner is a farmer and he plants corn, beans and flowers that he sells in the market. She dreams of continue carrying out her activity as well as to invest more in her products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tangerines, oranges, avocados, tamarinds, limes, mangoes, jocote and green papayas.

loans.use: To buy tangerines, oranges, avocados, tamarinds, limes, mangoes, jocote and green papayas.

loans.name: Enayat

texts.en:
Enayat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Ehab, appears in her Kiva profile photo, instead. Ehab's picture was taken inside his greenhouse. Enayat is a 27-year-old, married woman. She is a mother to two sons and three daughters. Her husband, Ehab, is employed and earns a small salary, but it is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past 20 years, the family of Enayat's husband has had a greenhouse project, planting different kinds of vegetables and selling the crops in the market. Now, Enayat's husband is operating this project, in order to improve his income and offer to his wife and children better living conditions. Enayat is requesting a 1,500 USD Youth Loan, which she will use to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing seedlings and agricultural fertilizers. Taking this loan will enable him to produce a better crop, thus increasing sales and improving the family's income.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers, which will enable her husband to grow more vegetables

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 55 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a weaver. Ly makes clothes at home to support her family. Ly started her business 13 years ago. She intends to take out a loan to gradually expand her business by buying fabric and materials to make more clothes and attract more new customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en: Lilit is from the village of Aygestan where she lives with her husband and little son. Together with her husband, Lilit is involved in agriculture. She keeps 17 chickens; cultivates potatos; and grows peach, apricot, cherry and pear trees. They own a greenhouse which is too old and needs to be renovated. As Lilit has insufficient funds for the renovation, she has applied for this loan. With this loan's help, Lilit will pay for the renovation of the greenhouse. This will enable her to cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables and make more agricultural income.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Aura Rosa

texts.es: Aura de 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de siete años. Ama su familia y considera que es la razón fundamental por la cual lucha diariamente a fin de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a una difícil situación económica por la que atravesó su familia, esta mujer decidió montar su propio negocio y ayudarle a su cónyuge con los gastos del hogar. Abrió una pequeña tienda dedicada a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar en su residencia la cual ha tenido un alto nivel de demanda, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para ampliar su portafolio de productos y realizar mejoras locativas. Su mayor sueño es expandir su negocio y poder convertirse en una fuente de empleo para su municipio.
texts.en:
Aura is 34 years old. She is married and has a seven-year-old son. She loves her family and considers her family to be the main reason that she fights every day to provide them with a better quality of life. 

Due to a difficult economic situation facing her family, this woman decided to open her own business and help her spouse with the household expenses. She opened a small shop which sells basic household products. The store is in her home and has had a high level of demand. It's for this reason that she is asking for a loan to expand her range of products and renovate her business. Her biggest dream is to expand her business to make it into a source of employment in her community.

loans.use: To buy basic household products and renovate her business.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 47 years old. He was born and lives with his family in Vanadzor city. Albert is married and has two sons. One son is a student at Yerevan State Economical University and lives in Yerevan. Albert's family is engaged in agricultural business and farming in Vanadzor city.
 
For many years Albert, himself, has been a butcher (meat-man). He rented a stall in a Vanadzor food market and sells meat and meat products. Twice a week, Albert buys meat from farmers and wholesale markets in Lori Province, and he resells it in his stall in Vanadzor food market. With the profits from his meat trading, Albert meet his family's needs and pays his son's tuition fees.

Albert has a big dream, to organize his own cattle breeding and to sell meat from his own farming. He has a plot of land near his house, and he decided to construct a barn for animals. For realization of his dream, he knows that he must work hard and accumulate money. Now, Albert needs to borrow 1,000,000 Armenian drams. He will use the loan to buy a large amount of meat from wholesale markets to resell, and three piglets with which to begin his animal breeding activity.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of meat from wholesale markets to resell, and three piglets with which to begin his animal breeding activity

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen, 53 years old, is married and has four children, three sons and one daughter. She and her husband support their family through the income they earn by making lanterns. They have begun this business thirteen years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Khen intends to take a loan to increase her working capital, buying materials such as floral glazed papers and bamboo. The additional materials will enable her to increase her production of lanterns for sale. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to make more lanterns, like floral glazed papers and bamboo

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, and all of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (her mother). She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food.

She sells green bananas at the market, on both a wholesale and a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past three years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 600,000 from MCDT – SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become solely a wholesaler and to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas to resell

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 42, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income by making flower pots to sell. Hien has been running this business since 1999.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business, by buying more, better-quality materials. She will use these to increase her production of flower pots. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income, to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more, better-quality materials with which to make flower pots.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc, 43, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income from planting water morning glory and raising pigs to sell. She started this business twelve years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying animal food to increase her selling of pigs. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy animal feed to raise pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto de 49 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos los cuales son su principal motivo para salir adelante. Cuenta que su único activo lo constituía un taxi de servicio público, el cual era su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Un vecino quien era propietario de una tienda le ofreció que cambiaran de negocios a lo cual el accedió y hoy se siente altamente satisfecho porque considera que las utilidades son mejores. Debido a que su negocio se encuentra en vía de crecimiento, Carlos se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y legumbres con el fin de mejorar su portafolio de productos. Espera que con esta inversión pueda garantizarles a sus hijos educación de calidad y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto, 49, is a father of two children who are his main reason to come out ahead. He says that his only asset is made up of a public taxi service, which was his only source of income to support his family. A neighbour who was a shop owner suggested to him that he change businesses to which he agreed. Today he feels highly satisfied because he believes the profits are better. 

Because his business is growing, Carlos is asking for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of household goods and vegetables with the purpose of improving his product portfolio. 

He hopes that with this investment he can guarantee his children quality education and an improvement in their lives.

loans.use: to purchase household goods and vegetables.

loans.name: Pay All Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Pay All Group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 800,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.
 
Seray is the featured leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a driver, and they have two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Seray has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells cartons of eggs. With her share of this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of eggs, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of eggs, to add to her current stock

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has been selling bedclothes for 15 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her two children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different kinds of bedclothes and repairing her shop that will allow her to attract more customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more different kinds of bedclothes and repair her shop.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: Fermin nació en la comunidad de Cuyo Grande (Pisaq, Cusco, Perú) pero ahora vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (Esta comunidad está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de la cual uno está a su lado pero los demás son independientes. Fermin es una persona responsable y trabajador que saca adelante a su familia y sus actividades económicas son la agricultura, la ganadería y la venta de ollas y fresadas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas. Su sueño es comprar un terreno en la ciudad del Cusco para construir una casa.
texts.en:
Fermin was born in the community of  Cuyo Grande (Pisaq, Cusco, Peru) but today lives in the community of Jajahuana. (This town is located in the District of Challabamba, Province of Paucartambo, Department of Cusco, Peru). Fermin is 45 years old and lives in a common law marriage from which 5 children have been born. One is still at his side, while all the others are independent.

Fermin is a responsible and hard working person who advances his family. His economic activities are focused on agriculture, cattle raising and the sale of pots and milled goods. It has been various years since he first dedicated himself to this business and things have gone well. 

On this occasion, Fermin needs a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds.  His dream is to purchase land in the city of Cusco on which to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to plant.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of food and beverages.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy a range of new products, including food and beverages. She will use the products to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products to sell at her store, particularly foods and beverages

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel nació en la comunidad de Jajahuana pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 21 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija (Ruth  de 3 años de edad). Maribel pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana porque es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividad económicas son la agricultura, la ganadería y a la venta de comida y mates. Ella viaja  a la comunidad de Jajahuana para las reuniones del banco comunal desde la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado. Su sueño de Maribel es comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Maribel was born in the community of Jajahuana but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. 

Jajahuana is located in the Challabamba districts within the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco, Perú, She is 21, is in a common law relationship and they have a daughter, Ruth, 3. 

Maribel belongs to the Santa Isabel de Jajahuana community bank because she is a responsible and enterprising person. 

She works in agriculture, livestock and selling food and mate teas. 

She travels to Jajahuana for the community bank meetings from Cusco. 

At this time she is asking for a loan to buy cattle. 

Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung, 34, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by selling vegetables. Dung started a grocery store two years ago. She sells, for example, potatoes, bitter melons, garlic, tomatoes, chilis, onions, and cabbages. She is requesting a loan to expand her business, by buying a greater variety of vegetables, and some household products, to resell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income, to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business, by buying a greater variety of vegetables, and some household products, to resell at her store

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan is 29 years old, is married, and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She and her husband have been running a business, planting and selling cactus, for several years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income with which to raise her child.

Thuan is requesting a loan to expand her business, by buying more kinds of cactus to meet her customers' demands. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest into her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of cactus to sell

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has a bus that he bought two years ago. He exerts himself to increase the income of his family. Sometimes, his bus is not running well, and that means he spends his daily expenses on repairing the bus. He intends to request a second loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to buy a new bus.

He thanks Kiva and the lenders for financing him in the first loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of four children, and all of them go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (her mother). Prossy sells charcoal in the market, on a retail basis. She works for seven days in a week, and she has run her business for eight years.

Prossy has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She wants the loan to enable her to buy additional bags of charcoal to resell at her business. She has no other source of income. The main challenges for her business are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business and earning enough profits to build her own house. She rents the house she stays in now, and the family has no access to electricity or to piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Yolanda Esther

texts.es: Yolanda desde hace 10 años, se dedica a las confecciones, actividad que surgió cuando observando la tarea diaria de su esposo, quien se dedica a la comercialización de artículos de publicidad institucional como almanaques, gorros, lapiceros, camisetas estampadas, le propuso fabricar ella misma las camisetas, y buscar alternativas de ofrecer uniformes y en general los productos derivados de su capacidad de confeccionar. Así fue como iniciaron y poco apoco su negocio ha ido creciendo, mediante ventas de contado, y a crédito, todos los días. Sus principales clientes son empleados y referidos por estos, que han ido agregándose como sus mejores compradores. Su meta es la de ampliar su taller y finalmente contratar operarias, cuando se requiera aumentar la producción, para ganar mas dinero y cumplir su sueño de tener una vivienda propia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará una máquina industrial descubridora, que la ayudará a mejorar los tiempos productivos y la calidad de las prendas, y a alcanzar gradualmente sus objetivos empresariales y los de bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
For the past ten years, Yolanda has worked as a seamstress. 

This work started from watching the daily work of her husband who markets institutional publicity items such as calendars, hats, pens and printed t-shirts.

She proposed to him that she would make the t-shits and to also make uniforms and other products that need to be sewn. 

This is how they started and little by little the business has grown through daily cash and credit sales.

Her main clients are workers and referrals from them. The referrals have grown and have become her best buyers. 

Her goal is to expand her workshop and finally contract workers for times when production needs to increase in order to earn more money and fulfill her dream of having her own house. 

She is applying for a Credikiva to buy a coverstich sewing machine in order to improve production times, the quality of the clothes and to gradually reach her company objectives and the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy a coverstich sewing machine and supplies such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
Magdaleno  tiene 47 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos; un niño de 6 años que asiste el primer año en la escuela y una niña de dos años de edad. Él cultiva 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y trabaja como ayudante de un albañil. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para reparar el piso de su casa ya que es de tierra y compara teja para ponerle al techo de la casa; pues es de lámina y hace mucho calor y lo que sobre lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes. Con la inversión evitara que sus hijos presenten problemas de salud al jugar en la tierra ya que están pequeños y que puedan vivir mucho mejor en su casa y con la cosecha poder obtener parte de la dieta de la familia. Su deseo es que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
Magdaleno, 47, has a common-law spouse and two children; a six-year-old boy who is in first year of primary school and a two-year-old girl. He farms 14,000 square meters of corn and works as a bricklayer's assistant. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundacion Campo (Foundation Field), is to repair the floor in his house since it is of earth and buy tiles to put them on the roof of the house, as it is of laminate and it gets really hot. The remainder he will use to buy fertilizer. 

The investment will avoid health problems his children may have when playing in the earth since they are small and can live much better in the house. And with the harvest he can obtain part of the family's diet. 

His wish is for his children to study at university.

loans.use: to repair the floor in his house since it is of earth and buy tiles to put them on the roof of the house, as it is of laminate and it gets really hot. The remainder he will use to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 48-year-old resident of Aggrey LC1 zone. She lost her husband in a car accident in 2002; since then, she has been the only breadwinner for her family of four children and dependents. Grace has an obligation of taking care of her sister’s children, because she also passed away three years ago, by paying their tuition from the little income she earns from her business.

Grace started this business seven years ago as a source of income. She started the business as a way of supporting herself and the family. Grace’s business is strategically located, but her major challenge is inadequate capital, which doesn’t enable her to buy enough stock; this also hinders its growth and expansion, hence the request to be funded.

She also has a dream of acquiring a piece of land on which she will build her own house, since her children are growing up and soon finishing their studies. Her neighbors recommended her for being a hardworking, determined and supportive person in society.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her sister's children). She sells charcoal at the market on a wholesale and retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She also gets additional income from operating a barber shop. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 2,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build a house and also buy a van for transporting charcoal from the village. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of them attending school. She has no additional family members. She rents the house she stays in. She has no access to electricity and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

Christine has a hotel [restaurant] in the market. She works seven days a week and she has run her business for seven years. She has no other source of income. The main challenges for her business are seasonality and transportation.
