Christine has applied for 500,000 Ugandan shillings to enable her to buy additional Irish potatoes, beef, cassava, rice and green bananas for her business. Her goals and aspirations include building a house.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, cassava, rice and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Joana's Group

texts.en:
Joana's group is a group with two members who live together. They sell maize, foodstuffs and vegetables.

The leader of the group, Joana, is 41 years old. She is married to Patrick and has two children, both of whom are still dependent and are going to school.

Joana herself attended school to the secondary level, and it is nearly eight years since she started her business selling maize from home. She does this in order to provide for her own needs and those of her children. She buys from suppliers in a market in Ghana.

In order to improve customer satisfaction, Joana is requesting 1,400 GHS (Ghana cedis) along with the other member of the Joana's group. This loan will help her to meet customer demand and make a bigger profit. 

They need a total amount of 1,900 GHS to be able to meet customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell to customers.

loans.name: Tahopaneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tahopaneh” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 500,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mariatu is the featured leader of this group. Mariatu is 30 years old; she is married with three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. Mariatu sells clothes. She is going to use her share of this loan to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Tanna Women Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tanna Women” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 500,000 leones each in order to invest in their respective businesses.

Hawa is the featured leader of this group. Hawa is 29 years old. She is married with two children – one in primary school and one in secondary school. Hawa sells fish. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: Brigida nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana porque es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividad económicas son la agricultura, la ganadería y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ella en sus tierras de cultivo siembre maíz, papa, cebada, trigo, tarwi, habas y otros para luego verndelas en diferentes mercados. Ella también se dedica al engorde de ganado. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Brigida was born in the district of Challabamba but lives in the community of Jajahuana. The community of Jajahuana is located in the district of Challabamba within the province of Paucartambo of the department of Cusco, Peru. She is 41 years old, married and has five children; fruits of this beautiful relation. 

She belongs to the communal bank Santa Isabel de Jajahuana because she is a responsible and enterprising person. Her economic activities are agriculture, livestock and breeding of minor species such as guinea pigs and chickens. On her land she grows corn, potato, barley, wheat, tarwi (an Andea legume), beans etc... so later she can sell them in different markets. She also works in fattening the cattle. 

At this time she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with five children, four of whom are attending school. She has no additional family members. 

Cissy sells old clothes in the market on a daily basis and works for six days in a week. She has run her business for 10 years. Cissy has applied for 500,000 Uganda shillings to enable her to buy additional clothes. She has no other source of income. The main business challenges for her business are seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes. 

Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business to a wholesale shop and also to educate her children up to university. She owns the house she stays in. She has access to electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy lubricants.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme de 44 ans. Elle est mariée à un douanier et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Depuis 2008, Akouvi vend des pagnes et des bijoux de façon ambulante. Akouvi sollicite son troisième prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter et revendre des pagnes et bijoux. Elle espère réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans l’activité afin d’ouvrir une boutique de pagnes et des bijoux. A terme, elle souhaiterait également pouvoir acheter un terrain et satisfaire les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Akouvi is 44 years old and is married to a customs official. She is the mother of three children, two of whom go to school. Since 2008, Akouvi has been selling pagnes (traditional wrap arounds) and jewelry on foot. Akouvi is asking for a third loan with WAGES to buy and resell pagnes and jewelry. She would like to reinvest the extra profits in her business to open a pagne and jewelry shop. In the long term, she would also like to be able to buy some land and pay her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and pagnes (traditional wrap arounds).

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna, de 39 años de edad , esta casada con Ramón y junto a él tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Mirna consiste en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, su especialidad son las colonias y perfumes, ella sale a la calle en busca de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares para vender algún producto o entregar aquellos que ya han sido solicitados con anticipación. Tiene en su casa un exhibidor pequeño en donde también ofrece a la venta estos productos a quienes la buscan en su hogar. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 2 años aproximadamente y lo hace sola. 
Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues tiene libertad para manejar su tiempo y organizarse de acuerdo a la disponibilidad de sus clientes, al principio como toda persona que recién empieza con un negocio propio tuvo algunas inseguridades pero con el tiempo pudo superarlos y ahora es una gran generadora de ingresos en su hogar, espera poner una boutique para ofrecer sus productos con mayor comodidad y en mayor cantidad.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará más cosméticos para tener en stock como perfumes, talcos y cremas corporales.
texts.en:
Mirna, 39, is married to Ramón and they have 4 children who live with them in their own house. 

Mirna sells cosmetics via catalogue. Her specialty are colognes and perfumes. She goes out to the streets to find friends, neighbors and acquaintances to sell a product to or to deliver the ones that have been ordered in advance. 

In her house she has a small display case where she also sells these products. She has done this job for the past two years and she works alone. 
She likes it very much because it gives her the freedom to manage her time to be available for her clients. 

At first, just like all people that first start out with their own business, she had some insecurities but with time she overcame them and now she generates a large income for her house. 

She hopes to open a boutique to offer her products in a more convenient manner and in larger quantities. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN ($400). She is very happy to know that she has financial support as this way she will feel more secure to keep going with her work and she is committed to paying her monthly installments on time. 

She will buy more cosmetics in order to have a stock of perfumes, powders and body lotions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, powders etc.

loans.name: Hugo Ernesto

texts.es: Don Hugo es una persona trabajadora amable y responsable, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 7 y 1 año de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años cultiva  maíz y fríjol tambien en su tiempo donde no hay cosecha se dedica a la compra y venta de madrera, con las ventas que realiza de su cosecha y de la madera logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades basicas de su familia, Don Hugo solicita un credito que le permita comprar insumos agricolas como semillas, insecticidas, abonos, entre otras cosas y poder alquilar la tierra que muetra en la fotografia donde siembra sus cultivos y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Hugo is a hard-working, kind, and responsible person.  He lives with his wife and their two daughters, ages seven and one.  

He has been a farmer for several years; he grows corn and beans.  Also, when it is not harvesting time he buys and sells wood.  With the sales from his harvest and from the wood he manages to cover the household expenses and his family’s other basic expenses.

Hugo is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, insecticides, and manure, among other things.  He will also use the loan to be able to rent the land, which is shown in the photograph, where he grows his crops.  This way he will be able to get better income in order to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, insecticides, and manure, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sayra Lizzett

texts.es: Sayra de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo vive en casa de la familia del esposo, tiene una  pequeña tienda desde hace un año y medio vende productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos, con las ventas que realiza y la ayuda de su esposo logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Sayra busca mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de artículos en su tienda, lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Sayra is 28 years old, and lives with her husband and son in her husband's family's house. For the past year and a half, she has operated a small general store that sells a variety of products for daily consumption, including soft drinks, juices, candies, snacks, and many other items. With the income she generates from sales at her store, she helps her husband with the household expenses. 

With the support from this loan, Sayra plans to purchase merchandise to stock her store and offer a greater variety of products to her customers. She hopes that this investment will help her to improve her quality of life and support her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repurchase inventory lost and damaged from Hurricane Sandy.

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes, madame Amélévi est une jeune dame de 34ans qui n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Démarré l’activité en 2010, Amélévi l'exerce avec joie car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. N’arrivant plus à satisfaire ses clients à cause du manque de marchandises, elle fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour atteindre ses objectifs. A l’avenir, elle espère devenir grossiste et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en: A pagne (traditional wrap around) retailer, Madame Amélévi is a young, 34 year old woman with no dependent children. She started her business in 2010 and enjoys her work as it brings in revenues, which allow her to take care of herself. She is no longer able to satisfy her clients due to a lack of merchandise, so she is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to meet her goals. In the future, she hopes to be able to become a wholesaler and start a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional wrap arounds)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 23 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre. Carmen se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Diariamente instala una mesa amplia en el que coloca todo tipo de golosinas como chocolates, galletas, caramelos, chicles y distintos bocaditos. Su puesto está ubicado en la puerta de un jardín de niños cerca de su casa y afortunadamente siempre tiene buenas ventas. Renueva sus productos de manera semanal llegando a invertir hasta 300 soles en cada compra. Lleva en esta actividad más de 3 años y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su madre. Eventualmente vende frutas y refrescos dependiendo del clima y del capital económico que tenga . Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico que ella misma genera ,el cual le permite solventar sus necesidades y colaborar con algunos gastos del hogar. Se siente muy feliz desarrollando su trabajo por que se siente útil a la sociedad aunque muchas veces ha sentido desistir por el cansancio, sin embargo, siempre renueva sus energías y continúa trabajando con mucho optimismo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el préstamo solicitado comprará progresivamente más golosinas como caramelos, hojuelas de maíz, chicles, galletas, bocaditos, frutas entre otros.
texts.en:
Carmen is 23-years-old, is single and does not have children. She lives in a house with her mother.  Carmen works in the sale of candies.  Everyday she works in a large table where is places all the different candies such as chocolates, cookies, caramels, gym and different treats.  Her store is located in a door in a garden near children and near her home. Fortunately, she always has good sales. She resupplies her business weekly, investing 300 soles in each buy.  

She has been working in this activity for the past 3 years and sometimes she receives help from her mom.  Eventually she sells fruits and sodas depending on the climate and the capital that she has.  She likes that her job provides her an income that she generates herself.  This income allows her to pay for her necessities and contribute to the expenses of the household.  

She is very happy growing her business because she feels useful to the community, although many times she is tired from the work.  Nevertheless, she always renews her energy and continues working with optimism. For this opportunity she is requesting 2500 soles. She is grateful for the opportunity and the confidence that is demonstrated in her to receive this loan. On the other hand, she promises to pay the quotas on time.  With the loan she will purchase more candy such as caramels, small corn leaves, chewing gum, cookies, snacks, fruits and other items.

loans.use: to purchase candy such as cookies, chocolates, caramels, and other items.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca de 61 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa propia se dedica la agricultura, desde hace mas de 25 años su principal siembra es el maíz y el fríjol, Es una mujer responsable y trabajadora con las cosechas que recoge logra solventar todos los gastos de su hogar. Doña Francisca solicita un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, entre otras cosas necesarias para seguir con sus cultivos y poder hacerle una mejora al terreno que muestra en la fotografia donde siembra sus cultivos ya que con los que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así tener mejores ingresos y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Francisca is 61 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. For more than 25 years, Francisca has made a living farming corn and beans on the land pictured above, and she is a very responsible, hardworking woman. The income she is able to generate form her harvests is always put towards covering her family's household expenses, but it is often not enough. 

With the support from this loan, Francisca plans to purchase agricultural products for tending her crops, including: manure, seeds, fertilizers and other items. She hopes that this investment will help her to improve the quality of her soil as well as her future harvests and overall quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products for tending her crops.

loans.name: Dominic Ansu

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Dominic, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 4,000,000 leones in order to invest in his businesses.

Dominic sells non-alcoholic drinks in the city of Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. A husband and the father of three school-going kids, this 54-year-old was born in Moyamba but now lives and sells in the city of Kenema. Dominic has requested this loan in order to buy crates of drinks to add to his current stock of drinks.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks to add to his current stock of drinks

loans.name: Sampson's Group

texts.en:
Sampson's Group consists of two traders who live in the city of Accra, located in the coastal part of Ghana. The members are hardworking individuals who have made sacrifices through their work so that they can improve the financial stability of their households and the welfare of their families.

Sampson, who has received loans from ID-Ghana for three years, is 34 years old, single, and has one child. He works in order to improve his finances and pay his child's school fees. They live in a rental property.

Sampson, a determined man who spends time taking care of his child and concentrating on his work, sells all types of shoes. He has been in business for ten years and is doing very well. His new loan will be used to purchase two boxes of shoes to sell. One of his dreams is to have a house of his own.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine, a God-fearing woman, has been running a grocery store selling fruits to local residents for five years now. She operates in a busy area and will use this Kes 20,000 loan to open another green grocery shop. Christine plans to use the anticipated profits to make savings at SMEP, and sees herself owning a big retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to open another grocery store.

loans.name: Tereso De Jesus

texts.es:
Tereso, posee una granja de pollos de engorde y asimismo se dedica al cultivo de maíz. El tiene 40 años de edad, está casado y su compañera de vida tiene 42 años de edad y también goza de tres hijos, los cuales están estudiando; el negocio lleva 15 años de conservarlo y trabaja todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le servirá para comprar pollo, concentrado y medicamentos para los pollos. Este le permitirá incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su objetivo es fortalecer más su negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Tereso has a poultry farm where he fattens up chickens, and he also grows corn. He is 40 years old and married, and his life partner is 42. He also has three children, who are in school. He has operated his business continuously for 15 years, and he works every day. 

The loan he needs will be used to buy chickens, feed and medicines for the chickens. This will allow him to expand his inventory and obtain a better income. 

His goal is to strengthen his business even more and offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicines for the chickens.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman, age 35, who has six children between the ages of nine months and 17 years. She operates a butcher shop located in a busy area. Her customers are local residents.

Alice plans to use this 95,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more meat to sell and to expand her business premises. She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She sees herself with many butcheries in five years' time.

Alice is honest and optimistic and hopes to give her children the best education and a comfortable life. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. She has repaid her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell and to expand her business premises

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (Esta comunidad está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene diez hijos de la cual tres de sus hijos están a su lado pero los demás son independientes. Él es una persona responsable y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y sus actividades económicas es trabajar para una empresa de mantenimiento de carreteras, él también se dedica a la agricultura, la ganadería, crianza de animales menores. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Su sueño es sacar profesionales a todos sus hijos.
texts.en: Mario was born in the district of Challabamba, but he lives in the community of Jajahuana. (This community is located in the district of Challabamba, in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Peru). He is 57 years old and married, and he has ten children, three of whom are living with him, while the others are independent. He is a responsible and hard-working person who is helping his family get ahead, and his economic activities are working for a highway maintenance company and also farming, raising livestock and raising small animals. On this occasion he needs the loan to buy small animals such as hens and guinea pigs. His dream is to help all of his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Shelly

texts.en:
A hardworker, Shelly is 31 years old and lives in Lusaka with her mother and four siblings. She sells mobile money transfers and airtime credit.

Shelly would like to serve customers who want to send and receive larger amounts of money, but because of her lack of working capital, she can’t. So she is applying for a 7500 ZMW loan through Zoona to add to her working capital, which is currently at $1000.

Shelly is happy with the opportunity to get this loan, as it will help her earn more in profits that will be used to enlarge her business. Her earnings will also help her to pay for her sister’s school fees.

loans.use: to grow her mobile money transfers and airtime credit business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Duber

texts.en:
This loan will help Duber and Iviet expand their fine dining restaurant.

Duber and his wife, Iviet, moved from Venezuela to Miami three years ago. Almost immediately, the married couple began working to turn their passion for the food industry into a profitable business. In May 2010, they opened Uvas Restaurant, serving French and Mediterranean gourmet cuisine, located on Biscayne Blvd in downtown Miami.

The restaurant is seeing great success, and the couple is able to support their two children as well as both of their mothers living in Venezuela. Duber and Iviet are now looking to expand. They need a loan to purchase a luminous sign as well as new equipment which will help them increase production in order to better serve more guests.

Visit Duber and Iviet’s restaurant at their website: http://www.uvasrestaurant.com/

loans.use: to purchase a sign and new equipment for his restaurant.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 36, is married and has two children aged three and five years. For the past five years he has run a welding workshop in a busy neighborhood. His customers are local residents.

This will be Joseph’s second loan with SMEP DTM. He successfully repaid his previous one for 20,000 KES. He plans to use this loan to offer more quality welding services to his customers as well as opening a battery charging shop.

loans.use: to improve the quality of his welding services.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Umu, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of  5,000,000 leones to invest in her business.

Umu sells cloth in the city of Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. A wife and the mother of three school-going children, this 46-year-old was born in the town of Kabala in northern Sierra Leone, but now lives and sells in the city of Kenema. Umu has requested this loan in order to buy bales of cloth to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of cloth to add to her current stock

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en:
A wife and mother of two school-going children, Neneh, 33, was born in Kono in eastern Sierra Leone. She now lives in Kenema.

Neneh sells clothes to make a living. She is applying for a 5,000,000 SLL loan through SMT in Makeni to invest in her business. With the loan she plans to buy dozens of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy dozens of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Caessar

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Caessar, a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 4,000,000.00 SLL in order to invest in his businesses. 

Caessar sells plastic bowls, plastic buckets, plastic dishes, etc. in the city of Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. A husband and a father of two children (one attending primary school and the other not of school going age), the 37-year-old was born in Kenema city. Caessar has requested this loan in order to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, plastic buckets, plastic dishes, etc. in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling maize in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Adjoa is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a trader. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells local dishes in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began five years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. Esi has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Therefore, she plans to use her loan to purchase more food in order to cook local dishes to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more food in order to cook local dishes to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Comfort did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Comfort prepares and sells ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste) in her village of Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. 

Comfort is married to a teacher, and together they have five children. She uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Comfort will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Banku’ sales. Comfort wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Banku’ sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She sells cooked food in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children.

Ama has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity.  Therefore, she aims to use her loan to purchase more maize to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to cook for sale.

loans.name: Fransisco

texts.en:
Fransisco is 43 years old, married and has five children. He was born in the community of Viscochoni but lives in Jajahuana, a part of the Challabamba district within Paucartambo province. He belongs to Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank.

Fransisco makes plaster from his small workshop in his home. He is applying for a 1500 PEN loan through Asociación Arariwa in order to maintain his machinery and buy firewood. He's happy with the idea of obtaining this loan and pledges to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to maintain his machinery and buy firewood.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling rice, bread and pastries in Enyan Apaa near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. 

Efua is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice, bread and pastries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice, bread and pastries

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her kenkey in Enyan Apaa near Cape Coast. She has been involved in preparing and selling kenkey for three years. Esi is married and has nine children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty kenkey. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize

loans.name: Adama Hawa

texts.fr:
Adama Hawa est membre de CAURIE depuis 2011. Elle a comme activité principale le commerce.

Elle est âgée de 31 ans,mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 4 filles.
Son aîné est âgé de 16 ans et son cadet a 02 ans.

Son activité de commerce consiste à acheter et à revendre du riz,de la farine,de l'huile;du sucre et des bombons.Elle dipose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type de commerce car elle le pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Avec le prêt reçu,elle compte acheter 12 sacs de 50 kg de riz à 14 000 francs CFA le sac, 7 sacs de 50 kg de farine à 22 500francs CFA le sac, 2 bidons d'huile de 20 litres à 20 000 francs CFA le litre, 2 sacs de sucre de 50 kg à 28000 francs CFA le sac et 19 paquet de bonbons à 15000 francs CFA le paquet.

Son objectif est d'accroître son épargne, constituer un bénéfice consistant pour augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et assurer les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Adama Hawa has been a member of CAURIE since 2011. Her primary business is commerce. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of five children, four of them girls. Her eldest is 16 years old and her youngest is two.

Adama Hawa's business involves purchasing and reselling rice, flour, oil, sugar, and candy. She has considerable experience in this type of business, since she has been doing it for several years.

With the loan she has received, she plans to purchase twelve 50kg sacks of rice for 14,000 CFA francs per sack, seven 50kg sacks of flour for 22,500 CFA francs per sack, two 20L containers of oil for 20,000 CFA francs per liter, two 50kg sacks of sugar for 28,000 CFA francs per sack, and 19 packages of candy for 15,000 CFA francs per package.

Adama Hawa's goal is to increase her savings and establish a substantial profit to increase her revenue and see to her daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase rice, flour, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Ramon  Bartolome

texts.es:
Ramón es un hombre de edad avanzada, tiene 63 años y con nostalgia recuerda sus años de infancia con su familia donde pudo terminar la escuela primaria. Está casado con Bella quien tiene 59 años y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, juntos han compartido la dicha de ver crecer a su hijo que ahora ya es un adulto independiente que formó su familia. Ramón vive con su esposa en la Parroquia de Río Verde en Santo Domingo, una ciudad del Ecuador que se ha convertido en uno de los puertos terrestres más importantes a nivel comercial, pues es en donde se unen las Regiones Costa y Sierra del país y por lo tanto en donde se intercambian productos de distinta índole y variedad; desde frutas tropicales hasta mariscos frescos traídos del mar. Por esta oportunidad que tiene la ciudad, muchas familias han salido y producido su sustento a través de la microempresa en diferentes industrias como la pesquera, bananera, manufactura, agricultura y ganadería. Además el paso de turistas nacionales internacionales es aprovechado para explotar la actividad turística con deportes extremos y caminatas a paisajes que tienen una belleza natural incomparable. 
Ramón forma parte de estas familias emprendedoras, pues heredó el espíritu trabajador de su familia y además un amigo le enseñó la actividad de comercializar pescado en la cual ya lleva 24 años, pues desde niño tuvo que trabajar para apoyar en el gasto de su hogar. Este hombre con alma aún joven, invierte 8 horas en su diario vivir para sacar a la venta su producto, el madruga a los puertos a retirar el pescado fresco para enseguida y con los debidos cuidados higiénicos, llevarlo a vender a un puesto que está ubicado en su residencia. Como es de suponerse el pescado es vendido en su totalidad cada día, de lo contrario tiene que ser congelado en temperatura bajísima para que no se eche a perder. Ahora Ramón requiere un préstamo que le ayudará a adquirir herramientas de trabajo y equipo para mantener en buen estado los activos que posee. Así podrá abastecerse de mayor producto y comprar variedad con mayor descuento para ofrecer a sus clientes un precio más competitivo que le generará mayor utilidad para poder disponer de un ahorro que responda a sus necesidades de salud y sustento en los años de su vejez con su esposa. Ramón agradece por cada granito de arena que se ponga desde cualquier parte del mundo a través de Kiva para que él crezca en su negocio ya que a pesar de su edad, nada lo ha detenido para seguir luchando cada día por su trabajo. También agradece a Fundación Alternativa de quienes ha recibido el apoyo, la confianza y agilidad que en varias instituciones financieras le hizo falta para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ramón is a man of advanced age; he is 63 years old and nostalgically remembers his childhood with his family, when he was able to complete primary school. He is married to Bella, who is 59 years old and works selling cosmetics from catalogs. Together, they have shared the joy of watching their son—now an independent adult with his own family—grow up. Ramón lives with his wife in the Río Verde parish of Santo Domingo, a city in Ecuador that has become one of the most important inland commercial hubs, as it is where the coastal and mountain regions of the country meet. As such, it is where a wide variety of different kinds of products are exchanged, from tropical fruits to fresh seafood brought from the ocean. Because of this opportunity that the city has, many families have gone out and earned a living  through small businesses within different industries such as fishing, banana farming, manufacturing, agriculture, and livestock production. In addition, they take advantage of the flow of national and international tourists to develop the tourism industry with extreme sports and treks to landscapes of incomparable natural beauty.

Ramón is is part of this group of enterprising families, as he inherited his family's hardworking spirit. In addition, a friend taught him the business of selling fish, which he has done for 24 years; he had to work starting from childhood to contribute to household expenses. This young-at-heart man invests eight hours of his daily life to selling his product. At dawn he goes to the ports to get the fresh fish to take it immediately and with the necessary hygienic measures to his sales stall, located in his house. As one might expect, he sells all the fish each day; otherwise, it must be frozen at extremely low-temperature so that nothing spoils. Now Ramón needs a loan that will help him to acquire work tools and equipment to keep his assets in good conditions. Then he will be able to store more product and buy a variety of fish at a greater discount in order to offer his customers a more competitive price. That will generate greater profits, which he can put into savings to provide for the health and living expenses of his golden years with his wife. 

Ramón is grateful for every grain of sand that is contributed from any part of the world through Kiva so that he can grow his business, because despite his age, nothing has stopped him from striving every day in his work. He is also grateful to Fundación Alternativa, from whom he has received support, trust, and flexibility—which are lacking in many financial institutions—to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase tools and work equipment.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Yolanda pues con su credikiva logró comprar tela y elaboró ropa para damas e infantil, aumentando con ello su capital de trabajo; tambien agregó mas clientes y aumentó sus utiliades. Su negocio se ha fortalecido y yolanda se encuentra muy contenta por contar con el respaldo de Kiva y de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su mensaje a los finaciadors de Kiva es el siguiente: " Estoy muy agradecida por estos préstamos que ayudan a mejorar mi vida. " En la actualidad está aplcnado a unc Credikiva con el cual comprará tela para elaborar  ropa femenina , para responder a la temporada de mayor movimiento comercial, encabezada por el primer domingo  de Mayo, dia en el cual se celebra el dia de la madres y Yolanda necesita tener el inventario preciso de vestidos de mujer, para responder las necesidades, deseos e intereses de las madres y de quienes ofrecen cariñosos detalles a un se maraviloso como lo es la madre o quien representa esta noble tarea.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Yolanda. With her Kiva loan she was able to purchase fabric and design clothing for woman and infants and increase her working capital. She also gained more clients and increased her profits. Her business has strengthened and Yolanda is very happy she can rely on assistance from Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She has the following message for the donors: "I am very thankful for these loans which help improve my life." Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan with which she will purchase fabric to produce ladies wear in time for the busiest shopping season, starting with Mother's Day on the first Sunday in May. Yolanda needs to have a full inventory of dresses in order to respond to the needs, wishes, and interests of mothers and anyone who offers loving gifts to a wonderful being such as a mother or whoever represents this noble task.

loans.use: purchase fabric for producing ladies wear.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Even though Adjoa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She sells garden eggs and palm oil in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 20 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. 

Adjoa has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more garden eggs and palm fruits to make oil to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more garden eggs and palm fruits to make oil to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Even though Mary grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently Mary is an entrepreneur. She sells soft drinks in Enyan Apaa near Cape Coast. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began six years ago. Mary uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children.

Mary has identified growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Karen Zulema

texts.es:
Karen es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros.  Karen es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante es por ello que luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella trabaja alrededor  de 8 horas y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es amable con los clientes, así como también por su responsabilidad y su optimismo.

Karen está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá mercadería para su negocio como perfumes, desodorantes, esmaltes, maquillaje, entre otros; ai podrá tener más productos para vender y ofrecer  a sus clientes, así ella seguirá luchando y trabajando para poder luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder estudiar la carrera de enfermería y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Karen is a young woman, 20 years old. She lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for its warm and welcoming climate, as well as for its agricultural activity, especially the cultivation of cotton and corn, among other crops. Karen is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead, and thus, after much effort and saving, she succeeded in starting her business selling beauty products. She works approximately 8 hours, and she can serve up to 10 customers per day. She believes that she is getting ahead because she treats her customers in a friendly manner, and also because of her responsibility and optimism. 

Karen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to your great support she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as perfumes, deodorants, nail polish, and makeup, among other items. Thus she will have more products to sell and to offer to her customers. In this way she will continue making an effort and working hard to make her greatest dream a reality: "Studying to become a nurse and having her own house."

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Naana is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries and kenkey in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Naana is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Naana wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries and kenkey. In the long term, Naana plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries and kenkey.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Don Oscar se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol cuando su cosecha esta lista los almacena en los graneros que se muestran detras de el en la foto para luego salir a comercializarlos a las agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos, Don Oscar esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: Oscar has worked in agriculture for several years and this has given him the capability and the knowledge he needed to tend to his crops. His main crops are corn and beans. When the crops are ready to harvest he stores them in the storage tanks seen behind him in the photo. He then sells them to the distributors located near his home. The income he earns for the sales goes to pay for household expenses. He lives with his wife and their 5 children. Oscar is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, seeds and fertilizers so he can increase his income and continue to help with the household expenses without limitation.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies such as compost, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling kenkey in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. Efua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her kenkey business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Even though Abena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Abena is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Banku’ for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She primarily sells her ‘Banku’ in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began seven years ago. 

She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children. Abena has identified that there is growing demands among consumers’ for her ‘Banku.’ Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Banku.’ 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty Banku.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en:
Eulogio was born in the community of Jajahuana and lives in the community where he was born. (Jajahuana is located in the Challabamba district, within the Paucartambo province and Cusco department, Perú). He is 36 years old, is in a live-in relationship and has six children. 

He belongs to Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank and their main economic activities are agriculture and livestock. He needs this loan to buy more animals, such as bulls and cows. He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth nació en la comunidad de Jajahuana y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 19 años de edad y tiene una relación unión libre de la cual tiene una hija (Jaselina de 2 años de edad). Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana pues es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, pan, gaseosas, dulces, galletas y otros productos. Ella también se dedica al engorde de ganado y a la crianza de animales menores. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar al por mayor pues los costos son más baratos.
texts.en: Yaneth was born and still lives in the Jajahuana community which is located in the Challabamba district in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru. She is 19 years old and is in a common law relationship and has a 2 year old daughter named Jaselina. She belongs to the communal bank Santa Isabel de Jajahuana. She is a responsible and enterprising person. She earns a living selling staple products such as rice, sugar, noodles, detergents, bread, soft drinks, sweets, and other products. She also raises small animals and fattens livestock. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar wholesale since it is cheaper.

loans.use: purchase sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.en:
Hermenegilda was born in the city of Cusipata and lives in the Challabamba district, within the Paucartambo province and Cusco department, Perú. She is 43 years old and has five children. She belongs to Santa Isabel of Jajahuana Communal Bank. 

She works in her restaurant business and prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. She has had her restaurant for five years and has been very successful.  She usually buys her ingredients wholesale. She buys noodles, sugar, rice, and oil, all at wholesale so she can get them at cost. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying ingredients wholesale.  She's happy about the loan and pledges to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to invest in buying ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua prepares and sells ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves) in her village of Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing this for about six years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have three children.

Ekua uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice and beans, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Wakye’ sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of rice and beans, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Wakye’ sales.

loans.name: Obaa

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Obaa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Obaa sells food items like plantains, yams, vegetables and others in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing this for about five years.

As a widow with four children, Obaa uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Obaa will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of plantains, yams and vegetables, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Obaa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of plantains, yams and vegetables.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: This loan will help Diego expand his pet salon business. Diego moved from his native country, Colombia, to Florida in 2010 with a passion for animals and the dream of beginning his own business in the U.S. Only a few months after arriving in a new country, Diego began Iron Pet Grooming Salon LLC, a storefront business that provides pet salon services including grooming, washing, teeth cleaning and tick treatments. Customers can also bring in their pets for the “You Wash” self service, where customers are able to wash their own pet while using Diego’s shampooing products and specially designed wash tubs. Now looking to expand his pet salon, Diego needs a loan to purchase a business vehicle and additional equipment, and to pay for marketing to help attract more clients. For more about Diego’s services and company, visit his website: http://ironpetgroomingsalon.net

loans.use: to purchase new equipment, a business vehicle and marketing materials.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is taking a loan of US$ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin.  She is married with three children and a husband who works as a farmer.

She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she lacks working capital. She wants to  buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as second-hand clothes, shoes and bags.  She is happy with Tuba Rai Metin, which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes and bags to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old.  She is married, and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. Her husband is a driver.  

Maria is taking a loan of US$ 600 to improve her business.  She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, eggs, shampoo, bread, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of US $150.  She is a hard-working woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, shampoo, cigarettes, bread,  soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba se encuentra dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 49 años de edad y tiene una relación unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos de la cual tres de sus hijos están a su lado pero los demás ya son independientes.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana pues es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividades económicas son: la ganadería, la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y chanchos. Ella también se dedica al engorde de ganado pues en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un toro que cuesta 1200 nuevos soles para luego venderlos a 3000 nuevos soles. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Felicitas was born in the district of Challabamba and lives in the same district where she was born. The district of Challabamba is located in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru). She is 49-years-old and has a free union from which she has 7 children. Three of her children are always at her side and the others are independent. 

She is a member of the community bank Santa Isabel of Jajahuana. She is a responsible and enterprising woman. Her economic activities include: cattle ranching, the agriculture, and breeding of small animals such as hens and pigs. She devotes herself to increasing the weight of the cattle she sells.  She requires a loan to capitalize on the opportunity to purchase a bill that costs 1200 new soles to later sell at 3000 new soles. She is grateful to all the people for the loan. She promises to pay punctually.

loans.use: to purchase a bull

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. Her husband works as a farmer and he has four children. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as sleepers, cigarettes, fish canes, oil, sugar, biscuits and others. She opened her kiosk 2000 with her own working capital of $500.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, fish canes, oil, sugar, biscuits and others

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and she is married, with four children  She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital.

She will use the loan of US$ 600 to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion, biscuits, books, pans, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, milk and salt. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, hard drinks, books, pans, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, milk and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, sleepers, detergent, soap, and hand body lotion

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Fe hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams that her business will continue to be successful. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients she needs, like meat, rice and seasonings, for her prepared foods business.

loans.name: Dinora El Carmen

texts.es: Dinora de 52 años es madre de un joven de 24 años de edad. Ella tiene una peluquería ubicada en un local alquilado, dela cual genera sus ingresos principales. Dese hace 20 años,   su experiencia de trabajo que la llevó hace 2 años a iniciar su propio negocio, ofreciendo las líneas de belleza como    peinado, cortes, tratamientos capilares, maquillaje, manicure y pedicure, dirigiendo su oferta  a mujeres, hombres, niños y niñas. En la actualidad ofrece sus servicios diariamente, durante 8 horas;  también vende mercancía asociada a la estética y belleza, como cosméticos, productos capilares etc. Dinora tiene en su cartera clientes fijos, ubicados en su vecindad y en los alrededores de ella y también forman parte de su cartera  los que estos le refieren , por encontrar calidad en su servicio. En la actualidad Dinora está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finamiento que hace al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará productos capilares, insumos de peluquería, como enjuagues, champo, pinta uñas, masajes para el cuero cabelludo, entre otros artículos. Su meta es impulsar su peluquería y mejorar sus instalaciones físicas, para lograr un completo ambiente confortable. Con su credikiva proyecta hacer una inversión exitosa, porque se acerca la época de mayor ingreso por efecto de sus ventas, con motivo de la celebración del día internacional de las madres, época en la cual las mujeres llegan a la peluquería para lucir hermosas y celebrar este día tan especial, al lado de quienes mas aman : su familia.
texts.en: Dinora is 52-years old and the mother of a 24-year old young man.  Dinora has a hair salon located in a rented space.  It is her primary source of income.  Her twenty years of work experience led her to open her own business two years ago.  She offers beauty services like hairstyling, haircuts, hair treatments, makeovers, manicures and pedicures.  She offers her services to women, men, boys and girls.  She currently offers her services every day, 8 hours a day.  Dinora also sells esthetic and beauty-related products, like cosmetics, hair products etc.  Dinora has a group of regular customers from her neighborhood and the surrounding areas.  Because of her high-quality service, her regular customers refer new customers to Dinora.  Dinora is currently applying for a Kiva loan; it is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan, she will purchase hair products and salon supplies, like rinses, shampoo, nail polish, scalp massagers and other items.  Dinora's goal is to drive her salon forward and improve the interior as to create a completely comfortable atmosphere.  Dinora plans to make a successful investment with her Kiva loan because her high season is approaching.  Mother's Day is coming up, and that is a time when woman come to her hair salon to shine with beauty and celebrate the special day with the people they love most- their families.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale hairstyling products like shampoo, dyes, balms, curlers, hairpins and brushes.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Ana Silvia es una señora de 23  años, casada, con 1 hija,  junto a su familia  actualmente viven en el municipio de  Sololá.
Ella se dedica  a la elaboración de ropa típica, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y después lo vende con familiares, amigas y en el mercado del municipio en donde reside,  llevan 1 año realizando dicha actividad con la que genera ingresos aceptables para aportar al sustento de su familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de hilo para elaborar ropa típica e incrementar sus ingresos y ganancias.
Su sueño es contar con un local fijo en el mercado local o en algún centro comercial para vender su producto.
texts.en:
Ana Silvia is a 23-year-old woman. She is married with 1 child and lives with her family in the municipality of Sololá.

She works in the creation of typical clothing. She completes this activity in her home and later sells her items to family members, friends, and in the market in the municipality where she lives.  She has been doing this activity for 1 year and generates enough income to sustain her family.  

She is requesting a loan of 4000, to purchase thread to create typical clothing to increase her income and earnings. Her dream is to have a fixed store in the local market or in a commercial center to sell her product.

loans.use: to purchase thread to create typical clothing

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
This is Emalyn, 40, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She’s married to Noel, a worker abroad, and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Emalyn is a rice dealer. She earns a living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by sacks or by kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1800 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional sacks of rice for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emalyn dreams of being a successful businesswoman. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more sacks of rice needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund, used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Teresita dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials needed in her recycling business.

loans.name: Karina Ivette

texts.es:
Karina, posee un comedor para generar ingresos y así invertirlo en los gastos del hogar. Ella no tiene hijos y está acompañada; este oficio lo lleva a cabo de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de pollo, rábanos, carnes, frijoles, repollos, lechugas, arroz, aceite, sal, entre otros productos para elaborar la comida y luego venderla.  Este le permitirá mejora la variedad de su producto, aumentar las ventas y así atraer más clientes.
Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Karina owns a canteen to generate income and cover the household expenses. She does not have children but she does have a companion. She works from 6:00 AM until 7:00 PM. The loan she requests will be used in purchasing chickens, radishes, meats, beans, cabbage, lettuce, rice, cooking oil, salt, and other items in order to prepare food and for sale later. This allows her to improve the variety of her products, increase her sales, and also attract more clientele. Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase chicken, radishes, beans, cabbage, lettuce, rice, oil, salt, and other products.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plátano desde hace seis años, negocio que inicio por iniciativa propia para obtener ingresos y así poseer una mejor calidad de vida. Ella está casada y tiene un hijo. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar platano, aceite, entre otros productos y asimismo adquirir pintura para mejorar su vivienda; esto le ayudara a tener una mayor seguridad en su casa de habitación y brindarle mejor protección a su familia.
Su sueño es ayudar a su familia y asegurar su vivienda, manteniéndola en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Concepción has earned her living selling toasted plantains for six years. She started this business on her own initiative to earn income and thereby have a better quality of life. She is married and has one son.

The loan that she needs will allow her to buy plantains and oil, among other products, and also to acquire paint to improve her residence. This will help her to have better security in her home and to provide better protection to her family.

Her dream is to help her family and to make their house more secure, keeping it in good condition.

loans.use: to purchase plantains and oil among other products, and also to buy paint to improve her house.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more merchandise products for her store. She was able to generate a larger amount of income and it helped with her family expenses. She has been in this business for three years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan in order for her to buy more stock of merchandise products like accessories. The more items displayed at the store, the better: more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams of having a shop in the mall and of being able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different merchandise products that she sells for her business.

loans.name: Irma Del Transito

texts.es: Doña Irma de 39 años de edad es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos: maíz y frijol. Doña Irma desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y tambien para poder hacerle una mejora a su terreno que muestra en la fotografia donde siembra sus cultivos. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Irma is 39-years-old and is a woman that is responsible with her household.  She always prioritizes giving the best to her children. 

Currently, she lives with her husband and her two children. She is very hardworking; She always completes her work with happiness and enthusiasm. She works in the agricultural seeding every year, mostly in basic grains such as corn and beans. 

Irma wants to increase her sales and for this reason is requesting a loan so that she can buy: seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides and other items to improve her land where she harvests. The land is in the photograph. She would like to count on the loan provided because she does not have any other monetary income and this way ensures providing the necessities to her family without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond’s business, mxdwn.com, began as a senior project in college. At the time, it was a simple idea about trying to build a website that leveraged connections in music information to build a resource for fans of music.

“In the beginning, it was as much about me learning how to program in dynamic programming languages such as PHP as it was about writing,” says Raymond. He and his friends quickly realized they were far more excited when focusing the site on the new music that thrilled them. After just a couple of years, what started as a fun project grew and grew until it became a thoroughly respected and trusted entity. The further they expanded their efforts, the more this simple hobby became something that needed to grow into a fully functional business. Now this project is one of the most known and respected online music magazines running today, keeping pace and growing in a highly competitive marketplace.

Raymond describes his work by saying, “It is the most exciting and rewarding work I've ever done. Every day I challenge myself to find the best music in the world and to bring that information to as many people as humanly possible.” He sees the future of his company evolving, as he says he aims “to take what we do so well and help focus this energy, drive and notoriety to harness that awareness and become one of the strongest revenue drivers for the music industry on the internet.”

Raymond is seeking a $10,000 loan for his website.

loans.use: to implement display advertising on his online music magazine and for marketing

loans.name: Delfa Mercedes

texts.es:
Delfa tiene 40 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y los padres en Chillanes Provincia de Bólivar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

Delfa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra fréjol, maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar líquidos insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, urea. Las compras y las ventas lo hará en Chillanes.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar los cultivos.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es mejorar la producción por perdidas y daños por fenomenos naturales. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear por el pueblo, visitar a los familiares.
texts.en:
Delfa is 40 years old, single, and has two children. She lives with her children and her parents in Chillanes, which is in Bolívar Province.

The Communal Bank “Virgen de Baños” is established in the community of Mama Sara de Cerritos, which is located 30 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose.

Delfa is a farmer who grows beans and corn. She is requesting a loan in order to buy liquids, farming supplies, compost, fertilizers, and urea. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Chillanes. With the help of this loan, Delfa will be able to improve her crops. The challenges she faces include improving her production from losses and damages caused by natural phenomena. In her free time, she enjoys walking through town and visiting with family members.

loans.use: to buy liquids, farming supplies, compost, fertilizers, and urea.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista nació en la comunidad de Jajahuana y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Jajahuana se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera  y tiene dos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal Santa Isabel de Jajahuana pues es una persona responsable y emprendedora entonces sus actividades económicas son: la venta de comida, frutas  y artefactos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo pollos, salchicha, papas y otros insumos. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Evarista was born in the community of Jajahuana and still lives in the same community where she was born.
